For that reason, as a member of 6-person borrowing group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, make-up kits, hair colors and some other varieties of products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. With the profit she will extend her business by opening one more beauty salon. She dreams to live a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Note: In the picture Asma is the one raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase products for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Shameem Group

texts.en:
Shameem, pictured raising her hand, is a 45-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband has a welding shop, and one of her sons is a taxi driver. They are living in a rented house, and it's very difficult for them to pay their rent. 

Shameem is a beautician by profession. Since 2009, she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the salon is almost out of beauty supplies; therefore, Shameem wants to purchase new cosmetic products to continue her business. 

As a member of a six-person lending group, Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors, and other products. She would also like to buy some new chairs for her salon. With the profit, she would repay the loan and save to build a home with her husband. Shameem is very hopeful that the loan will be productive for them, and she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra cuyes y gallinas. Agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Judith belongs to the "Reyna de los Angeles" (Queen of Angels) communal bank and her principal economic acivity is raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy more guinea pigs and hens.

She is grateful for the offered opportunity and she promises to comply with payment of her different quotas at their scheduled times.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs and to be able to save.

loans.name: Mukhtiar Group

texts.en:
Mukhtiar, pictured raising her hand, is a 35-year-old hardworking woman living with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is deceased, and its very difficult for her to manage the household expenses. She is running a small general store, and she needs additional capital for the growth of her business. 

As a member of seven-person group, Mukhtiar has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to buy a variety of goods and grocery items like rice, sugar, cereals, and milk and introduce some new products in her general store. She wants to spend the profit on the education of her children, and she is looking forward to a better future for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her general store.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 31-year-old university student who is majoring in Arabic Language. Because of financial difficulties, he took a while at the university.

Hamzeh is requesting an educational loan to help him finish his studies and pay for his last year's registration fees.

loans.use: pay for registration fees

loans.name: Genil

texts.en:
Genil is 28 years old and married with three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past three years, Genil has owned a retail business in his local community and he earns 3,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010.

Genil is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell such as coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and noodles. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and noodles

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a snack food-selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura continua al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y  leche entre otros productos. Laura en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería y surtir su comercio. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Laura continues with the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the province of Urabamba in Cusco, Peru.  She has a grocery store in which she dispenses products in high demand like rice, sugar, noodles and milk among other produts.  Laura is taking this opportunity to invest the requested loan to buy merchandise and supply her business.  The member is thankful for the loan and promises to complete the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to by rice, sugar, noodles and milk among other products

loans.name: Rukhsana Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana, pictured raising her hand, is a 35-year-old hardworking woman living with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is insufficient to meet their household expenses. Rukhsana runs a small general store, and she needs additional capital for the growth of her business. 

As a member of five-person group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to buy variety of grocery items like rice, sugar, and cereals and introduce some new products in her general store to satisfy her clients' needs. She wants to increase her monthly income and savings for the better future of her children. She would reinvest the profit in her business, use part of it to pay her household expenses, and spend part on the education of children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Nasreen Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, pictured raising her hand, is a 55-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and two daughters. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Nasreen’s husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Nasreen is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 15 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

As a member of a seven-person lending group, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently and increase her production. She is currently living in a rented house with her family, and she dreams of building her own house. She also wants to expand her business and to provide a quality education for her children. With the profit she will pay the rent on her house. Nasreen and her family are very thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to stitch  more dresses.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married parent of four children. She works hard to support her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. Josefina also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Josefina is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell at her store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 76 years old and widowed with 11 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 10 years, Dominga has owned and operated a food vending business in her local community. She earns 4,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2007.

Dominga is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products, such as snacks, to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products such as snacks to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 48-year-old illiterate married woman. During the day, she works as a farmer and in the evenings she sells blankets and snacks from her home. 

Fatmeh is requesting a loan to buy new types of bed covers to sell. She hopes to enhance her business.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers to sell

loans.name: Ghenie

texts.en:
Ghenie is 35 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works abroad while he manages a store for income. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, sardines, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell. It will help improve his sales capacity and income, as well. 

Ghenie hopes to keep achieving a good income for his children's education and to achieve better employment, someday. He hopes his wife will not be working abroad anymore.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sardines, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh, is a 29-year-old, hard-working lady. She works in a university, as a cleaner. Her husband is a farmer and they have their own nursery houses that she wants to expand. For that, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to expand their nursery houses and plant new seeds.

loans.name: Nuevo Fruto Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Alma mujer de 25 años de edad casada, con tres hijos menores de edad de 2, 4 y 2 años respectivamente, tiene 4 años de tener su negocio de una pulpería y venta de frijoles cocidos anteriormente trabajaba como operaria en zonas francas poco a poco fue  reuniendo dinero de su pago hasta que formo su pulpería y está cerca en el  cuido de sus hijos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo, bisuterías, medicamentos populares, cosméticos como perfumen de varón, perfumen de mujer, lociones etc. Hellen mujer de 31 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la zermat, Avon venta de ropa variada como camisas, chores, pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer etc. y Arli tiene 37 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de fritanga todos los días en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is a 25-year-old woman named Alma. She is married and has three young children (a four-year-old and two two-year-olds). Alma has a grocery business and also sells cooked beans. She previously worked in the Free Trade Zone as an operator and gradually saved up her money until she was able to open her store. This enabled her to be near her children so that she could look after them. Her loan will be invested in basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, trinkets, popular medicines, cosmetics, men’s colognes, women’s perfumes, lotions, and other items.

Hellen is a 31-year-old woman who has a business of selling Zermat and Avon cosmetics. She also sells various clothing such as shirts, shorts, men’s trousers, women’s trousers, and other items.

Arli is 37 years old and has a business selling fried foods every day from her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, trinkets, popular medicines, cosmetics, men’s colognes, women’s perfumes, lotions, and other items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos (Marlene, Edgar, Laura y Daniela), ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Victoria se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos cuenta que los días lunes, miércoles y sábados viaja a la ciudad del Cusco llevando sus productos para venderlos en uno de los mercado de la misma ciudad. Ya son 32 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas como por ejemplo de flor, repollo, lechuga, sapallo, etc. La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank. She is a native of Urubamba, is 51 years old, and has 4 children (Marlene, Edgar, Laura and Daniela). Victoria is a responsible mother who at each moment is searching for opportunities to advance, and through her daily efforts, to provide a better future for her children.

Victoria sells vegetables. She tells us that on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays she travels to the city of Cusco, transporting her products to sell in one of the city's markets. She has dedicated herself to this business for 32 years, and it has gone well, thanks to the effort she puts into the business.

Victoria needs the present loan for purchasing seeds to plant, including for example, flowers, cabbage, lettuce, pumpkins, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and, at the same time, Victoria promises to comply with all scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant such as flower, cabbage, pumpkin, etc.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Mr. Nergui, 59, lives with his wife and two stepchildren in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His wife has retired from work and now gets a state pension. She also makes and sells clothes on order for vendors and some enterprises. Mr. Nergui's stepson works as a watchman and renders taxi service to local people on his day off. His stepdaughter works as a cook at a restaurant. Mr. Nergui himself has been providing taxi services to local people since 2008 and has accumulated a lot of experience. Before providing taxi services, he worked transporting goods between districts. 

The automobile Mr. Nergui's stepson uses for taxi services has not been paid off. Mr. Nergui is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to pay the remaining automobile costs. When the last payment is posted to the automobile seller's account, the automobile will be Mr. Nergui's stepson's asset. Mr. Nergui is a very hardworking individual who, despite his age, is working hard to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay remaining automobile fee

loans.name: Olman Josue

texts.es:
Olman, tiene 27 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
La zona donde vive Olman es apta para la agricultura, tiene una finca de café que comercializa en pergamino en el mercado local. Esta actividad le ha proporcionado cubrir las necesidades de su familia, el precio del café se mantiene y es rentable.
El esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante y darle mantenimiento a la finca, mantenerla libre de toda plaga, para que sus cosechas sean de buena calidad y vender a buen precio.
Piensa seguir trabajando con los préstamos para tener el capital para darle la asistencia necesaria  a su finca.
texts.en:
Olman is 27 years old, and is married with two children. He lives in the municipality of Taulabe, in the zone of Comayagua, a region which is known for its farming and agriculture. Olman makes a living as a coffee farmer, and he sells his produce in the local market. His farming operation is his family's only  source of income, and Olman is grateful that the price of coffee remains fairly consistent and can help him to support his family. 

With the support from this loan, Olman plans to purchase fertilizers for use in cultivating and tending his coffee plants. He hopes that this investment will help him to keep his plants free from pests and diseases and will lead to full, healthy harvests of coffee beans that will fetch a good price in the markets. Olman plans to continue with his farming operation and with micro loans as a complement to his own efforts.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for cultivating his coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 55 years old and has two children. She is a widow and sells fruits, vegetables, and fish for income. She had been in the business for three years and earns about 2,000 PHP each month. She hopes to keep earning good income for her family, which is why she hopes to diversify her business for better profits. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplants to sell. Additional revenue will be invested in school expenses.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is a 24-year-old married lady with one daughter. Besides being a mother, Bayan is also a university student majoring in Physics. After graduation, she wants to look for a job as a teacher. Now Bayan is applying for an educational loan to pay the rest of her semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay the rest of her semester registration fees.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en: Gaith is a 25-year-old single man, living with his five siblings and his parents. Gaith is a university student. He used his previous loan for education and is applying for another one for the same purpose. He will use the loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Margelita

texts.en:
Margelita is 46 years old and married with six children.

Margelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables.

She has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Margelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: G.s Los Prados#2 Group

texts.es:
El Señor Luis es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposa y sus   hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es compra y venta  de granos desde hace más de 9 años. 
Don Luis préstamo lo necesita para la compra de granos maíz. Con el crédito espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan  y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Don Luis al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan que con la inversión que realicen a sus negocios su situación económica mejore un poco. En unos años esperan ver sus negocios  posicionados  como los más reconocidos de la zona.
Don Luis espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.
Don Moisés su negocio es  compra  y venta  de granos  básicos desde hace 5 años. 
Doña Mayra  su negocio es la  venta  de  ropa  usada desde hace 5 años.




Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del 2013
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is an enterprising person who lives with his wife and children in a community of Choluteca, which is in southern Honduras. He has been in the business of buying and selling grain for more than nine years.

Don Luis needs a loan so that he can buy corn kernels. With this loan, he hopes to increase his sales since he will have additional capital by which to acquire fresh product to offer to his customers. As a result, he will be able to fulfill their needs.

Don Luis and his fellow group members hope that this investment in their businesses will gradually improve their economic situation. In a few years, they hope to see their businesses positioned among the most well-known in the area. Don Luis hopes to continue supporting his children so that they will become outstanding members of society and have better opportunities.

Don Moisés has been buying and selling basic grains for five years. Doña Mayra has been selling used clothing for five years.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn kernels to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Chincheros y vive en la ciudad de Urquillos de la provincia de Urubamba. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
texts.en:
Florencia is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She was born in the city of Chicheros, but currently lives in Urquillos in Urubamba Province. Her main business activity is selling vegetables, but she also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been in business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Florencia is a member of the Communal Bank “Reyna de Los Angeles”. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Rolita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Ma. Rolita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Ma. Rolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 38-year-old conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Basma is the mother of four daughters. She and her family established a small coffee booth where her husband is currently working to support the family. Now Basma is applying for a loan to add new types of hot drinks to the menu.

loans.use: to add new types of hot drinks to her family's coffee stand menu.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 47-year-old widow. She is supporting her six sons and daughters by herself by selling clothing items from home. She applied for this loan to increase the quantity and the variety of her products and improve her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in her loan request photo. 

Haya’s husband sells carpets, while she sells home products from home. Haya applied for this loan to increase the quantity of home products she has to sell in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of home products she sells.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of four sons and one daughter. Mona has a home products shop that she wants to expand by renting the shop opposite hers. She applied for this loan to increase the quantity she has of products so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of products she has for sale.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 58-year-old illiterate woman. After her husband passed away, she was left to raise three sons and a daughter. Her youngest is now 14 years old. To be able to support the family, Fatmeh sells clothes and blankets from home to neighbors and their friends. Now Fatmeh is applying for another loan to buy more bed covers to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers for sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 33-year-old married woman with four daughters and one son. Aisha recently started a home business selling clothes. She has a good quantity of clothes but no equipment to help organize and display her products. She is applying for a loan to enhance the area where she shows her clothes and to buy some clothes hanging equipment. She also wants new fashionable clothes that goes with the culture in her area.

loans.use: to buy some clothes hanging equipment and new fashionable clothes

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en: Lynie is 46 years old and married with five children - three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lynie has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19500 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Lynie would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle to use for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old and has eight children. She has been widowed for one year. She carries the burden of supporting her family's needs alone. Four of her children are still in school. 

Janet earns about 5,000 PHP each month from the retail store she operates. Her income goes for school fees and reinvesting in the business. 

Janet hopes to improve her sales, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, softdrinks, eggs, and noodles to sell. Additional revenue will be reserved for school expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, softdrinks, eggs, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoudah

texts.en:
Mahmoudah is a 34-year-old illiterate woman. She and her husband are both farmers. After the workday is done, Mahmoudah goes back home to take care of her two sons. She also sells blankets at home to make additional income. 

Mahmoudah is working on enhancing her business, so she applied for this loan to purchase more bed covers in different sizes.

loans.use: to purchase more bed covers.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 41 and the mother of two boys and a girl. She is a conservative woman, so Faten asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Faten's husband has a medium-sized food market with which he supports the family. Faten is applying for this loan to help her husband enhance the variety of goods he sells at the store.

loans.use: to add more variety to the products her husband sells.

loans.name: Shamsa

texts.en: Shamsa is a 52-year-old mother of seven children. Her husband is a bus driver while she sells blankets and home products at her house. She is applying for this loan to increase her profits by buying more home products to sell. That will help in supporting her family and expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling lechon (roasted pig) in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Maricel is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her lechon.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her lechon (roasted pig).

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a retail store owner from Solana. She is 29 years old and married to a carpenter. They have two children. She sells grocery items and vegetables to the people in her village. She usually earns PHP 5,000 each month which goes toward meals, education expenses and revolving capital in the business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs and bread to sell. 

Someday, Jocelyn hopes to achieve better profits for her children's education and someday lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs and bread to sell

loans.name: Moawiah

texts.en: Moawiah is a 31 years old and single. He has three siblings and they live with their parents. Moawiah works in a governmental entity during the day and after that he goes to his shop where he sells tissues, baby paper goods and some cleaning products. Now, he is applying for this loan to increase the quantity and variety of goods to sell to increase his profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and variety of goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man. He is the father to two daughters. His wife works with the civil defense department and he works in the Ministry of Education. After that he goes to work on his land where he has built a nursery area for plants. Ahmad is applying for a loan to get more seeds and some tools for farming.

loans.use: to get more seeds and some tools for farming.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 46-year-old divorcée who has established a home printing house at her home. She uses simple tools to print cards and some advertising material. She applied for this loan to get more material for her work in order to produce larger quantities at fewer prices.

loans.use: to get material for her work.

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa is a 30-year-old conservative woman who asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. She is the mother to 5 children. She takes care of them and works in their home-based food store where she sells candy and other food products. She is now applying for a youth loan to bring new types of food products to her store.

loans.use: to bring new type of food products to her store to sell.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 25 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children and her mother in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. 

Chan requests a loan of $300 to hire bulldozer to smooth her land for building a new house. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to make more income for the family.

loans.use: to hire a bulldozer to smooth her land for building a new house.

loans.name: Srey Neath

texts.en:
Srey Neath is 19 years old. She is a first-year university student, who lives with her parents in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a second daughter in the family. She graduated from high school in 2012.

Since she has an extensive family, which has seven members, her parents cannot provide enough support for their children. Therefore, Srey Neath requests a loan of $3050 to pay for her tuition fee. This money will help her to obtain enough financial resources to pursue her university studies. In the future, she hopes to get a good job as a banker, in a financial institution in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and fees

loans.name: Señor De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑOR DE LA CRUZ”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carpintería, venta de comida, elaboración de alfombras de lana, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; cuenta que este negocio familiar, ya que lo trabajan hace años y ella también tiene un pequeño capital invertido en el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras  mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones en crédito.
texts.en:
Señor de la Cruz Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It's made up of 10 members and governed by a board of directors of which Adela is the president.  The various businesses of the communal bank members include carpentry, food sales, wool rug production, neighborhood store, and vegetable sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs such as Adela.  She says it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling fruit.  She says it's a family business that she has worked in for years and in which she has a small amount of capital invested. 

This loan is to increase her capital by buying fruit, which she'll get from wholesale vendors and then sell in her stand.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, because she lives in a common-law marriage and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the health area and the loan training.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.en:
Fulgencia is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost three years ago for a loan to expand her business. She is receiving her 6th loan and will use it for her home's improvement. She is running a business where she sells underwear. She lives in a rural area in the Puerto Plata.

Fulgencia is the mother of two children, one of whom lives with her and her long term partner. Because they are living in deteriorated housing, she is requesting a loan which she will use to improve her situation by purchasing building materials to finish her house. She will buy a door, ceramic tiles for her floor, and she will cover with cement her concrete blocks walls. With this loan she will be able to finish building what she started several years ago. 

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They then can request loans to improve their house structure while they are running their businesses and attending group meetings.

loans.use: To buy a door, cement, ceramic flooring, etc

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing.

Rosemarie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosemarie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for over five years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

Cherry joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en:
Jihan, 30, is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to appear in her loan request photo in her place.
 
Jihan and her husband support their three sons with a small cafeteria business where Jihan's husband makes sandwiches and provides hot drinks.

Jihan is applying for a youth loan to improve the shop's interior decor and the quality of service provided.

loans.use: to improve the decor at her husband's shop.

loans.name: Willalyn

texts.en:
Willalyn is 32 years old and married with three children. With all the children in school, Willalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Willalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Willalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie is 38 years old and married, with three children who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rizalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Rizalie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Inshirah

texts.en: Inshirah, is a 55-year-old housewife. She has an engaged daughter and a single son. To help in supporting the family Inshirah sells detergents at home to friends and neighbors. She wants to expand her business and sell to small enterprises. To be able to do so she has applied for a loan to increase the quantity she has of detergents.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of detergents she sells.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 47 years old. She lives in Chiatura District. Gulnara had requested for a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time due to her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Gulnara is out of source now and has requested for a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Gulnara will open a grocery store. She plans to purchase a stock of groceries and after opening the store work as a sales lady and increase her income. She will be able to improve her family's living conditions and purchase all the needed daily supplies. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocey store.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 54 years old. She lives in Tkibuli District. Marine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and poor living conditions. 

Marine works as a housekeeper and gets a small monthly income.

Recently, Marine requested a loan from Credo to start up a business. Her loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Marine will begin to trade in clothing. She plans to purchase clothing from the wholesalers and then resell at higher prices. This will increase her income, and Marine will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to begin a new business, selling clothing

loans.name: Trabajadoras Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRABAJADORAS HORMIGUITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ximena es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de linaza, pintura de madera, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, elaboración de joyas, costura de chamarras, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ximena es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio o emprendió hace varios años, por recomendación de su madre y en la actualidad es su fuente de recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras en La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias provinciales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta los préstamos y el apoyo en salud.

En la fotografía aparesen acompañando al grupo la asesora que esta vestida con saco violeta y la hija de señora Maruja, ella esta vestida con una chamarra megra.
texts.en:
The "Trabajadoras Hormigitas" communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is composed of eight members, led by a board of directors of which Ximena is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include selling flaxseed oil, wood paint, neighborhood store, food sales, jewelry-making, sewing jackets and sewing backpacks. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners such as Ximena. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of her mother, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling cosmetics. She indicates that she started this business several years ago at her mother's recommendation, and that currently it is her source of income.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital through the purchase of cosmetics, which she will acquire from the distributors in La Paz and then sell in the provincial markets. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household as much as she can, as she is in a common-law relationship and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans and the health services. 

Accompanying the group in the photo is the advisor, who is dressed in a violet jacket, and Maruja's daughter, dressed in a black jacket.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Akapana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AKAPANA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de lana, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, tienda de estucos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pensión); da a conocer que este negocio empezó con un negocio anterior donde la suegra vendía comida, posteriormente decide ella realizar la venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes) que adquirirá de las ferias las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago porque ríen y ganan experiencia de trabajo con bancos.
texts.en:
Akapana Communal Bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Nancy is the treasurer.  The various business of the communal bank members include wool sales, food sales, refreshment sales, weaving blankets, knitting sweaters, and plaster sales.

This loan will benefit small business entrepreneurs such as Nancy.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, joining on the invitation of a counselor from the institution who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling food (meals).  She says this business began with a previous business where her mother-in-law sold food.  Later she decided to sell this product. 

The loan she's getting is to increase her working capital by buying groceries, which she'll get at area markets; then she'll prepare meals to sell in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says she likes the payment meetings because they laugh and get work experience with banks.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya, 39 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own small wooden house on fenced land. She and her husband have been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. 

During spring time when the graduation ceremony of university students occurs, demand for flowers and souvenirs increases drastically so she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to order the above mentioned items from China. 

Narantuya, using her previous loan, has built a small barn as an extension to their house for heat preservation and paid each installment on the established schedule without delay. The borrower is a very hardworking and trustworthy individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase flowers and souvenirs

loans.name: Alejo

texts.en:
Alejo is engaged in a transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been in this business for six years and usually earns about 300 PHP (Philippine pesos) a day, this income is just enough to cover their family's daily meals. 
Alejo wants to renew his licence, but he has insufficient cash. In this regard, Alejo is asking for a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy spare parts, new wheels (exterior and interior) and to renew his licence. He hopes to obtain his loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, new wheels (exterior and interior) and to renew his licence

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 39 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business, which is banana production, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns PHP 2,000 every month.

She has joined in GDMPC in the year 2010. Now, she has requested a loan of PHP 4,000, which she will use to purchase chemicals for banana production. She will use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 61 years old. He lives in a small village of Tkibuli District. Omar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Omar is involved in agricultural activities. He has four milking cows, a pig, and a vineyard with 300 samples of wine trees. 

Recently, Omar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit Omar will purchase four beehives with bee colonies. He will produce honey for selling. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 62 years old, married with 5 children; she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Nenita owns and operates a pig-raising business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years, and earns PHP 6,000 every month. 

Nenita joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. 

She will use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking mother who raised her five children while she was working to bring income to her house, which she is still doing for her livelihood in her small and rural community on the outside of Puerto Plata. She has been taking loans with Esperanza for almost four years, belonging to the group Women with Purpose. She is accessing this loan to build a decent bathroom in her house. 

Angela is requesting a loan which she will use to build and buy all the details for a bathroom. She will purchase a sink, toilet, a shower, ceramic for the floor, and also she needs to make concrete block walls and the roof. Angela is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional for a loan to expand her business. 

She joined this group in one of the rural villages in Puerto Plata, where she has received loans to invest in her business selling clothes. Esperanza Internacional is running a program where their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity in their groups. They then can request loans to improve their house's structure, while running their businesses and attending groups meetings.

loans.use: To buy cement, concrete blocks, a sink, toilet, and other bathroom fixtures.

loans.name: Sebaq-Alzmn Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sebaq-Alzmn. It is made up of four women who are neighbors from Aden, Yemen. They are hardworking women. 

They are taking a loan of 140,000 YER. Fawziah is the group leader; she is 38 years old and married. She is a very efficient woman, she says, because aside from caring for her family, she likes to work and thus help her family. She has six children all of whom are in school. 

Her business is selling mobile recharge cards, which has been her sole source of income for over three years. She started her business selling in the market in her area with limited capital. 

At the present time, her business doesn't make more profit because she lacks capital to expand her business. So she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB to acquire mobile recharge cards to sell, thus giving her the opportunity to improve the income from her business.

loans.use: to acquire mobile recharge cards to sell to customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve the income from her business.

loans.name: Cantalona Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CANTALOMA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de ganado, tienda de barrio, producción de leche, producción de queso, producción y venta de hortalizas, elaboración de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año y cuatro meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió viendo la necesidad de sus vecinos y le pareció una oportunidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza y refrescos) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The "Cantaloma" communal bank will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional office. It is composed of eight members, and led by a board of directors of which Amalia is the chair. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied and include: cattle raising, neighborhood store, milk production, cheese production, production and sale of vegetables, and the making of shawls. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners such as Amalia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year and four months ago, at the invitation of a field worker of the institution who came to visit her at her home. 

Currently she has a neighborhood store business, and indicates that she learned this business, seeing the need of her neighbors, and it seemed to her like an opportunity. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital through the purchase of beer and soft drinks. She will acquire these from the distributors, and later sell them at her shop. This form of work will allow her to generate income to support her household as much as she can, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings program.

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Radhi Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Radhi”; it is made up of three ladies and one man.  This is a group that demonstrates initiative, values, and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. They requested a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB. 

Athina is 42 years old, a married woman with 7 children; she is the leader of this group, and she lives in Aden, Yemen. She is a merchant; specifically, she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. She has been doing this for two years. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. 

Athina started this business because of the lack of a clothing market in her neighborhood. She is very grateful to her neighbors who have supported her over all these years. 

With the income from her business, she was able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comforts. She applied for a loan of 35,000 YER from AMB to acquire clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. She will sell them to her customers, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business.

loans.use: to acquire clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ra'fat

texts.en:
Ra’fat is a 36-year-old married man. He is a father of two children. 

Ra’fat works in a governmental entity during the daytime, and after that, he goes to university to study nutrition. He is applying for this educational loan to help him pay for the rest of his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 26-year-old, conservative, single lady. She asked her brother to take her place in the picture.

Suha helps her father in his sheep-trade business. He buys a number of sheep, feeds them, and takes care of them, and then sells them. Now, Suha is applying for a youth loan to increase the number of sheep they have.

loans.use: to increase the number of sheep in their sheep-trade business.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 43-year-old hardworking single lady. She has two younger siblings. 

Hind has a small tailoring workshop where she has worked for the last five years. She started very small at home, and now she managed to make new customers and open her own tailoring workshop. 

She is applying for a loan to buy more sewing machines and other tailoring tools to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines.

loans.name: Duha

texts.en: Duha is a 20-year-old single lady. She is a second year student majoring in media and communications. She is applying for an educational loan to help her in paying for the next semester's fees.

loans.use: pay for the next semester's fees.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 51-year-old conservative woman; she asked her son to appear in the photo in her place. Muna is the mother of six sons and daughters; one of them is Talal, who is currently a university student. 

Muna is applying for an educational loan to support her son in his education path, and pay for his registration fees.

loans.use: pay for her son's college registration fees.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño, papa, maíz y hortalizas, venta de comida, venta de queso, costura de polleras y pantalones, producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chuño y tunta (papa deshidratada)  y papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace años y en la actualidad trabaja con este negocio para generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chuño y tunta) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su la ciudad de Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The community association “ESTRELLITAS” will begin their seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center. It has eight members and is directed by a board of directors of which Ruth is president. The association's members are involved in various different business activities, which include the sale of chuño (dehydrated potato), potato, corn and other vegetables, the sale of food, the sale of cheese, sewing skirts and pants and potato farming.

The loan will benefit micro-businesswomen of which Ruth is a member. Ruth joined Pro Mujer six months ago when a member of the institution visited her at her home and invited her to join. Currently, Ruth works selling white and black chuño and potatoes. She learned this business from her parents years ago and it is currently her primary source of income.
 
She will use the loan to increase her capital (buying white and black chuño), which she will purchase from distributor companies. She will then sell the chuño in the city of Oruro. This method of work allows her to generate income to help maintain her household as best she can as she has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ruth answers that she likes the opportunity for loans and the training they offer.

loans.use: buy white and black chuño

loans.name: Amigas De Puerto Perez Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE PUERTO PEREZ”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanesa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de conejo, tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanesa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio empezó con un al observar que una de las tiendas de la comunidad no abastecía las necesidades de la población.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados, azúcar, aceites, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Puerto Pérez” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Vanesa.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are food sales, fish sales, rabbit sales, neighborhood store and CD sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Vanesa.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a neighborhood store and she relates that she started the business when she noted that the one of the neighborhood stores did not meet the population’s needs.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy canned goods, sugar, oil, etc. in nearby street markets and will subsequently resell them in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her home the best way possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 24-year-old single guy. He is a brother of three siblings. 

Khaled works in a sports clothing shop and also goes to the university to study to get a Bachelors degree in computer networking.  He is now applying for an educational loan to pay for his registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his registration fees.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her parents. She is a third year university student majoring in Accounting. 

She is applying for an educational loan to help her pay her next semester's fees.

loans.use: pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is a 24-year-old single guy. He has three older siblings and another three younger. Being in a big family brings more financial pressure to the family, which is why Ashraf goes to work to help the family and support himself at the university. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for the rest of the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of the semester fees.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como gallinas.
texts.en:
Rocio is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. She was born in the city of Quillabamba, but currently lives in the city of Urubamba in Urubamba Province. Her main business activity is selling basic necessity products, but she also raises small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. Rocio has been in business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Reyna de Los Angeles” and is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy small animals, such as chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Nowah

texts.en:
Nowah lives at Sinkor (a section of Monrovia) in the capital city of Liberia, in Montserrado County. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. Nowah is 40 years old and married, with four children between the ages of 20 and 26. 

For the past ten years now, Nowah has been running a market table where she sells rice, pepper, bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable), Vita (juice drink), and other items. She started this business with the help of her father and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. 

Nowah is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, Vita, and other items for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, Vita, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 62 years old. He lives in Rustavi District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter. Nodar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the income of his wife and daughter-in-law. They both are working as salesladies. In addition, his son works as an artisan and gets a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nodar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nodar will purchase groceries and open a grocery store, as he has a commercial space already. After the store is opened, he will be able to increase the income of the family, which will be more stable and they will have a chance to improve their living conditions. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the environment of the family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and open a grocery store

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia del Carmen de 55 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, con seis hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente. Es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa donde vende productos de consumo básico para el hogar, como granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos congelados, leña, entre otros lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Negocio el cual tiene ya  10 años de haberlo iniciado,  Lucia es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, ella inicia su negocio con dinero propio, con el objetivo de mejorar los ingresos de su hogar el cual ha ido mejorando ahora ella tiene que velar por ella misma.  El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, debido a que este ha ido creciendo y así ofrecer a sus clientes  diversidad de productos. Lucia del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a los comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua
texts.en:
Lucia del Carmen, 55, is from Chinandega; she has six independent adult children.  She owns a home-based grocery store where she sells basic home consumption goods like basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, frozen items and firewood, among others.  It’s located at home.  The business has been in operation for 10 years.  

Lucia is a very hardworking, responsible woman.  She started the business with her own money aiming at improving household income which has in fact been improving; now she must support herself.  She needs the loan to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store to meet customer demand because it’s been growing and she wants to offer her customers a variety of products. 

Lucia del Carmen thanks Kiva lenders who provide help for merchants of scarce resources and for poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia tiene 37 años, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 17, 10 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada en su puesto de venta de la  zona 15 de Mayo,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Lucia va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para la construcción de una habitación en su casa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos materiales,  La Sra. Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de venta de ropa y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de ropa   y también en la ampliación de su negocio para poder captar más clientes La Sra. Lucia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia is 37 years old, married, with three children, ages 17, 10 and 6. She sells seasonal clothing at her stand in the 15 de Mayo area. This loan is her first with the institution. 

Lucia is going to use this loan to buy construction materials for building a room in her house. Her reason for requesting this loan is lack of cash for the purchase of these materials.

Lucia faces challenges in her business, such as the weather, and also competition from other businesses selling clothing. She is going to use the profits in the purchase of a variety of clothing, and also in expanding her business so that she can get more customers. 

Lucia is a very hard-working person, and feels happy about the opportunity offered by the granting of this loan.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 28 years old. He lives in the small village of Gardabani District with his wife and two daughters (6 and 8 years old). Several times, Koba requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a small, monthly income of Koba's. He rents a bakery, where he bakes bread for selling. The income is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Koba requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Koba will renovate a space located in his yard and purchase all the needed equipment to start his own bakery. He would not have to pay rent and, thus, the income of the family will increase. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery on his property.

loans.name: Hafizan

texts.en: Hafizan is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing "Paranda," a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan, for many years. Women use it for a traditional look on special occasions like Eid (a holiday) and weddings. She receives many orders on a daily basis and earns enough to contribute to the family income. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 18,000 to purchase more raw material such as thread, pearls and beads in various colors and in large quantities. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support and feels confident in running her business independently to support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase more raw material such as thread, pearls and beads in various colors and in large quantities.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Ms Naila is a 20-year-old, vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. Having these items will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate healthier income. She is in her first loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Ms Kalsoom is a 42-year-old, energetic, married woman. She is a mother of seven children, four of them school going. For the past seven years, she has been doing a business of manufacturing waan (which is a material used in making charpoy, i.e., a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and has become famous in her community for providing good-quality waan. 

Her husband is working as a labor worker in the power looms, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members.  She requires improving her business, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she will be able to buy another waan-making machine for her husband to use, to assist her in his free time.

While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, she said that her children have never slept without having a meal, ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to use part of the revenue generated by using the loan, for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine for her husband to use, to assist her in his free time.

loans.name: Familia M Group

texts.es: “Familia M” tiene ya varios ciclos trabajando con la institución el grupo está conformado por cuatro integrantes y todos son familiares. Andrea es parte del grupo, tiene 27 años de edad está casada desde hace 12 años con su esposo Jesús juntos han formado una familia con cuatro niños de los cuales tres se encuentran estudiando Andrea se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebe desde hace ocho años cuenta que inicio con su actividad porque  sus suegros y su esposo son comerciantes pero también inicio porque siempre ha querido ayudar a su esposo Jesús con los gastos del hogar, Andrea cuenta que todos los días en los que hay plaza se dedica a la venta de ropa, en todas las plazas ya tiene un lugar bien establecido “Me va muy bien cuando vendo en las plazas normalmente voy mas cuando las señoras reciben su apoyo de oportunidades me gusta vender este tipo de ropa porque además se vende con mucha facilidad” Aunque también argumenta que le gustaría tener mas variedad para poder agradarle y atraer más clientes con el crédito que recibirá tratara de comprar más ropa de distinta variedad lo que le ayudara ampliar un poco mas su negocio. Andrea quiere hacer más grande el negocio porque quiere lograr que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Mientras que Doña Juana invertirá en jarcería, Don Jesús invertirá en ropa interior y Don Fidencio invertirá en juguetes y productos de fantasía. Estas son personas ya son clientes de la institución desde hace varios ciclos por lo que están muy agradecidos y contentos por el apoyo que KIVA y VisionFund México les han otorgado porque cuentan que sus negocios han crédito favorablemente aunque ya no se venda igual pueden tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Familia M” has been working with the institution for several cycles now; it’s composed of four members who are all members of the same family.  Andrea is part of the group.  She’s 27-year-old and married for the last 12 years to her husband, Jesús.  They have formed a family together of four children three of which attend school.  Andrea has been working for 8 years selling infant wear.  She relates that she started this activity because her in-laws and her husband are merchants but she also started because she wanted to help her beloved husband, Jesús, with household expenses.
