In the future, she would like to have a shop where she could sell her embroidered guipiles. The other women in the group work in handicrafts and animal husbandry.

One group member is not in the picture because she was unavailable at the time it was taken.

loans.use: to buy fabric to embroider guipiles [Guatemalan tunics]

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old, separated, and has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns PHP 5,000 every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use it to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, canned goods and noodles. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additonal products to sell, like sugar, coffee, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 42 year old. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been raising pigs for four years; she gets PHP 6,000 monthly from this.

Wilfreda provides for the needs of her four children from the small amount she gains from her business, in addition to income from her husband. 

In 2008, Wilfreda became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 at GDMPC micro finance to buy feed. 

Wilfreda wants to expand to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a "sari-sari" or general store in the Philippines.

Gigi has asked for a loan of 25,000 Philippines Pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., so she can buy items such as canned goods and groceries to sell in her general store.

Gigi has been in this business for 25 years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Gigi aspires to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods and groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en: Jemma is 32 years old and has two school-age children. They live happily in a rural community, through farming. Due to financial constraints, they put up a small motorcycle repair shop in the local community to generate additional income. They aimed to improve the business and provide a better service to their customers. But, due to insufficient capital, Jemma is applying for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy interiors, exteriors, gasoline, diesel fuel, used tires, welding rods and acetylene needed in the repair shop. They are hoping that the loan will help them improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy interiors, exteriors, gasoline, diesel fuel, used tires, welding rods and acetylene needed in their motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy nylon, seashells and other paraphernalia for her business. Chona successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Chona's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nylon, seashells and other paraphernalia for her shells-crafting business.

loans.name: Anna Rizza

texts.en: Anna Rizza is 24 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over two years and earns PHP 4,000 every month. She just joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services, and to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her rice farm.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 43 years old, married, with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns PHP 2,000 every month. 

Marita joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase chemicals for banana production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Margaret Nancy is a fish vendor. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She and her husband work hard to support their family.

Margaret Nancy is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 24,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more fish to offer for sale to her customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business. Her primary goal is to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, 32 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost two years; with this business she earns a net income of PHP 7,000 a month. 

She would like to get a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, noodles, biscuits, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted immediately so that she can purchase more grocery items for her retail store.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, milk, noodles, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business. Leonarda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Leonarda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 44 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns PHP 9,000 every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010, and now she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Rowenalyn

texts.en:
Due to a lack of job opportunities, Rowenalyn runs a small variety store in her village to generate income. She is 23 years old and still single. She aimed to help her parents to improve their status of living and educate her younger brother and sister. For this reason, she planned to improve her variety store to generate a higher income.

She is asking for loan capital of PHP 12,000, which she will use to buy more stock to sell in her store, like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, noodles, and seasonings. She is hoping that someday, she will improve her business even more through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, of items like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, noodles, seasonings, snack foods, dried fish and vegetables

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Vilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell in her store, such as rice, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as rice, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been in her business for over five years and earns PHP 7,000 every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 8,500. She will use it to purchase chemicals for banana production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production

loans.name: Shafeela

texts.en:
Shafeela, age 27, is a homemaker who lives with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has operated a business selling sunglasses for the past two years and works very hard to meet his family's needs. However, due to his low monthly income, the family is currently facing many problems. 

Because her husband needs additional capital to ensure the growth of his business, Shafeela has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that that she can invest in her husband’s business. With the loan money, her husband will buy a greater quantity and variety of sunglasses to satisfy client demand. This will allow him to grow his business and to increase his savings. He will use the expected profits from his business to expand the enterprise, pay household expenses, and support his family.

Shafeela and her husband are confident that this loan will be a fortunate, productive investment for them. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: buy a greater quantity and variety of sunglasses to offer for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 57-year-old very industrious woman. She does farming for her family, and wants to lift her family out of poverty and save for the future. That’s why she is determined and passionate about her work. 

To achieve her dream, she is requesting a loan of 37,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides to be used to develop her farming business. 

She just hopes to make a higher profit out of these inputs, to lift her family from their poor living conditions, as well as to save for her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is 55 years old and lives with his wife and children in the village. He has been a farmer for over 35 years, and earned PHP 20,000 from previous cropping. 

His goal is to further increase his profit. So he has requested a loan of PHP 37,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides. 

His children also help him,  to improve their source of income. Julito hopes through their cooperation and hard work, he will be able to increase his income to upgrade their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas de 40 años de edad ,esta casado con Edita y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de adobe . Desde muy niño logró instruirse en las actividades del campo ya que era el único sustento de su familia y hoy con 20 años trabajando de forma independiente decidió seguir con el rubro del cacao orgánico .Posee terrenos de cultivo de las cuales el cacao orgánico ocupa casi el setenta por ciento del área que labora, conjuntamente con el apoyo de su esposa y en ocasiones con el de sus hijos .Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que no depende de terceros para desempeñar su labor y porque considera que el cacao es uno de los productos más vendidos en su localidad. No obstante tiene problemas para transportar los sacos de cacao pero esto no lo desanima a seguir adelante.  Este es su segundo con crédito con Kiva y esta muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con los  S/.3,000 soles comprará sacos de abono orgánico los cuales benefician su producción.
texts.en:
Leonidas, 40, is married to Edita, and they live with their 2 children in a house built out of adobe.  From a very young age he managed to teach himself to do farmwork, since this was the only source of support for his family.  Now, after working independently for 20 years, he has decided to continue to work growing organic cocoa.  Leonidas owns agricultural land, and he is growing organic cocoa on almost 70 percent of the area that he works jointly with his wife and, occasionally, his children.  He really appreciates his work because he doesn't have to rely on others to perform the labor, and because he considers cocoa to be one of the best-selling products in his area.  He does face some problems transporting the sacks of cocoa, but this doesn't discourage him from continuing on.  This is his second loan with Kiva, and he is very grateful for the financial support that he is receiving so that he can continue with his work.  He pledges to make his payments on time.

With the 3,000 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy sacks of organic fertilizer to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn, age 33, earns an income by running a food stall business in her community, where she cooks and sells a variety of meals and snacks. She and her husband have three children. Mailyn's goal is to improve and strengthen her business in order to generate sufficient income to to support the financial needs of her children and to provide her family with basic necessities.

To improve the business, Mailyn is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000. She will use her loan funds to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings, bananas, flour, oils, and sugar. This will allow her to prepare more meals and snacks to offer for sale in her community. 

Mailyn is confident that her patience and hard work will allow her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings, bananas, flour, oils, and sugar

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a clothes-selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Maria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like blouses, slippers, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Maria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items like blouses, slippers, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, 43 years old, has been blessed with three children. She manages a livestock business, and she has raised hogs for almost 10 years. From this business she earns a net income of PHP 1,300 for every hog that she sells.

She requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000, which she will use to purchase hog feed and pigs to raise. Her income is always spent on the expenses of her children in school. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will be able to gain more income in her business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and pigs to raise

loans.name: Lorgenia

texts.en:
Lorgenia lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and single. Lorgenia owns and operates a retail business. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns about 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lorgenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation. Now, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use it to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, sardines, rice, coffee, sugar and soap. She plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, sardines, rice, coffee, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Ma. Margarita

texts.en:
Margaret Margarita, age 39, raises pigs to earn an income. She has managed her piggery for almost seven years now and earns a net income of PhP 3,000 for each hog she sells. She and her husband are blessed with three children.

Margaret Margarita is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase hog feed and more hogs to raise

She is grateful for this loan because it will enable her to gain more income and better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando, age 58, is a farmer. He has managed the family farming business since he was 19 years old. He has stayed single because of the hardships and difficulties he has faced in promoting his siblings' future. Nevertheless, he is still thankful, because he has the strength to continue to enhance his farmland. 

Fernando is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 37,000. He will use these loan funds as additional capital in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to make his farm more fruitful. 

He hopes to increase his profits so that he can save for future and further invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been engaged in rice farming for more than three years. Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farming business and eventually her harvest and yield. In the future, Evelyn hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Jayson is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has two school-age children. Being a responsible father, he aimed to upgrade his family's living standard. Aside from farming, Jayson used his motorcycle in a transport business to generate additional income. He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Through this financial assistance, he believes that he will continue using his motorcycle transport to earn income for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Los Nuevos Group

texts.es: Citlaly tiene 25 años de edad y tiene tres niños los cuales dos de ellos estudian la primaria, ella es parte del grupo llamado Los Nuevos, platica que su grupo es muy trabajador y que les gusta trabajar con VisionFund porque no les cobra altos intereses. Ella desde hace diez años tiene un puesto de frutas y legumbres en el centro de su población, dice que renta un local y que sus padres fueron la que la ayudaron a rentar ese puesto ya que justo al lado ellos también tienen su negocio, dice que empezó con este tipo de actividad porque ella ya ya lo conocía, gracias al de sus padres. Ya que Citlaly se caso muy joven sus padres les ayudaron con un puesto nuevo para que pudieran salir adelante. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de frutas y legumbres ya que le gusta surtir fruta de primera calidad. “me gusta que mi negocio este bien surtido y que la fruta este fresca y de buena calidad para que mis clientes no se me vayan con la competencia”.  Ella surte las frutas y legumbres en la central de abastos cada tercer día ya que ella está en una ubicación donde vende muy bien en el centro de la ciudad. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Alma, J Remedios, María Guadalupe, Hilda, Javier, Diana y Mayra ellas invertirán sus créditos en el negocio de compra y venta de flores para arreglos, en la compra de material para hacer manualidades para su venta, en tela para elaborar prendas de vestir, en la compra de masa para hacer tortillas a mano, en la compra de colchas por catalogo para su venta y en la compra de zapatos por catalogo para su venta.
texts.en:
Citaly is 25 years old, and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school. She is a member of the community group, “Los Nuevos” (The New Ones), and Citaly is grateful to be part of this group that she feels is very hardworking and genuine. She also likes working with VisionFund because they apply reasonable interest rates to borrowers. For the past ten years, Citaly has operated a fruit and vegetable stand near the center of her town. She rents out the space next to her parents’ stand, and learned the trade and flow of the markets from them. Since Citaly married young, her parents decided to help her with the initial rent payments to get her stand and business up and running.

With the support from this loan, Citaly plans to purchase high quality fruits and vegetables to stock her stand and offer a wider variety of produce to her clients. “I like to always keep my stand well-stocked with the highest quality of produce to make sure I stay competitive,” Citaly comments. Every third day, Citaly visits the supply center to restock her produce.

The other group members are Alma, J Remedios, María Guadalupe, Hilda, Javier, Diana and Mayra. They work in various other trades, including: floral sales for arrangements, craftmaking, fabric and cloth sales, tortilla making and sales, as well as buying blankets and shoes from catalogs for local resale.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables for resale at her market stand.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor de 43 años de edad, está casado con Rosalía y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera.Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico en unos terrenos que se encuentran a una hora de su hogar .Gracias al clima selvático los frutos del cacao obtienen una buena calidad logrando convertirse en una buena alternativa de negocio para todos los productores de la zona .Actualmente desea invertir en su producción con cacao injertado para el cual debe contar de manera indispensable con mano de obra de trabajadores del lugar quienes conocen la técnica para cumplir la tarea en un menor periodo posible, adicional a ello debe adquirir sacos de abono orgánico para que sus cultivos tengan un buen resultado .Uno de sus sueños a futuro es concretar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble para el beneficio de su familia .Siendo este su primer crédito otorgado por parte de Kiva razón por la cual agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con los S/.4,000 soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembrios y contratará trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Victor, 43, is married to Rosalia, and they have 4 children.  The family lives in their own house which is made of wood.  For 20 years, Victor has been growing organic cocoa on land that is located an hour from his home.  Thanks to the jungle climate it is possible to grow good quality cocoa beans, and so this is a good business alternative for the producers in the area.  

At this time, Victor wants to invest in grafted cocoa, and for that he needs to hire day laborers who know the technique in order to perform this task as quickly as possible.  Also, he needs to acquire sacks of organic fertilizer so that he will get a good harvest.  

One of Victor's dreams for the future is to finish building his house with solid materials for the benefit of his family.  As this is his first Kiva loan, he is thankful for the opportunity that he is being provided, and he promises to make his payments on time.  

With this 4,000 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy organic fertilizer for his crops, and he will also hire local workers.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and hire local workers

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de cuyes,la socia los hece engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puead vender los cuyes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para cuyes.


La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Fortunata continues to make a living in raising guinea bigs.  She makes them gain weight and grow, and she later sells them at the different markets.  She works from 8AM until 5PM.  She has been in this business for seven years and her business is going very well.  

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her guinea pigs.

She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and the food for her guinea pigs.

Fortunata is grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and the food for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fishing business in the local community, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns PHP 5,000 every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use it to purchase fishing materials, such as hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, such as hooks and nets

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 27 years old and married with four children.

Lolita is in the hog raising business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in hog raising for four years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her hog raising business.

Lolita is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jill

texts.en: Jill is 40 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn  to earn a living. She has been in business for over eight years and earns PHP 5,500 every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,500 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her farm.

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: Davaajav, 49, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides on a plot of land in their own house which was built with loan funds. Davaajav's wife has been sewing deel (a Mongolian traditional costume) at home for 14 years. His second son lives on his own, and his youngest son now studies at university. Davaajav himself has been running a transportation business using his own truck since 2008 and accumulated vast amounts of experience. He is requesting a loan of 5500000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, cotton, foam, bricks and planks. During this period of time, the price of building and insulation materials reaches its lowest level and buying them now will save him a considerable amount of money. Using those building and insulation materials, he will build his own house which will enable the family to burn less coal in comparison with a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). During winter times, especially last winter, family members are chilled to their core due to strong snow storms blowing walls and frost forming between felt layers of their ger. So, building a house is the best way of staying warm during the cold winter and, more importantly, of reducing coal usage to contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.en: Juliana is a thirty-four-year-old farmer and mother of six children. Her husband is also a farmer. Their agricultural business is negatively affected by drought and poor transportation to deliver goods to the market. Juliana is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program to earn money, conserve the soil from erosion, and change the environment. She intends to use the profits from her KOMAZA tree farm to educate her children, buy food for her family, and buy more land.

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, age 39, is a farmer. She lives with her husband and their four children in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business involving the planting and harvesting of vegetables, and she has been engaged in her business for over six years. She earns PhP 3,000 per month. 

Merlinda has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000, which she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her farmland. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her agricultural venture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy, age 33, runs a general store business to earn an income. She lives with her husband and their two children in Bayawan, Negros Oriental, and she works hard to provide for her family. She has been running her store for eight years and earns an additional income from farming peanuts, corn, and rice, as well as raising livestock.

Joy has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF.  She is presently requesting a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional stock items such as bread, snack foods, canned goods, and cooking oil to sell in her general store.

Joy's aspiration is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock items such as bread, snack foods, canned goods, and cooking oil to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, age 60, owns and operates a retail store business to earn a living. She and her husband have raised three children and live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Leonora has been in her business for over nine years and earns PhP 3,000 per month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010, and she is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase such items as shampoo, soap, and canned goods to sell in her store. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase such items as shampoo, soap, and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina, age 58, owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in her local community to earn a living. She and her husband have raised one child and live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns PhP 8,000 per month. 

Martina has been a member of GDMPC since 2009, and she is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to purchase spare parts and tires. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, age 33, owns and operates a shoe repair business in her village to earn an income. She has been running this venture for almost 15 years and earns a net income of PhP 300 daily. 

She and her husband, who is a farmer, have been blessed with two children.

Marites is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which she will use to purchase nylon, shoeshine paste, and other materials needed for her shoe repair business. 

Her goal is to continuously develop her business, which will allow her to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, shoeshine paste, and other materials needed for her shoe repair business

loans.name: Sonavar

texts.ru: Сонавар жительница района Джиликул. Ей 32 года. Она живет с мужем. У нее двое маленьких детей. Сонавар имеет среднее образование. Она у себя дома занимается пчеловодством и земледелием. Этими видами деятельности она занимается шесть лет. Сонавар берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений для урожая.
texts.en: Sonavar lives in the Jilikul Region. She is 32 years. She lives together with her husband. She has two young children. Sonavar has finished secondary school. She keeps bees and grows produce by her home. She has been in this line of work for six years. Sonavar is taking out a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers and increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and increase her harvest.

loans.name: San Alejandro Agricultura Group

texts.es: La señora Verónica lleva ya varios ciclos en este grupo y dice que a través de los préstamos y el timepo ha notado mejorías en su negocio, dice ella “cuando empecé a trabajar con la financiera tenía nada mas una nave de invernadero, ahorita ya tengo 10 naves ya que le he puesto mucho empeño a mi negocio y lo he hecho crecer” ella desde hace 12 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de flores de noche buena por mayoreo, dice que sus meses altos para la venta es desde octubre  hasta diciembre y que cultiva diferentes tipos de variedades de noche buena, dice que su esposo va a venderlas al estado de México y que saco una producción muy buena de mas de 7000 flores y que gracias a que ha tenido buenas ventas esta levantando poco a poco su casa de concreto ya que vivía en una de madera. “aunque es un trabajo muy pesado es satisfactorio ver a mis clientes que se van con una cara de contentos ya que mis flores son de muy buena calidad”, Vero como es conocida en su comunidad esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de macetas, tierra y abonos ya  que ahorita ya empezó la temporada del cultivo y necesita las macetas para empezar a distribuir los esquejes de la noche buena, para empezar a cultivarla. Dice que invita a la gente a que le vengan a comprar o a ver sus viveros ya que es también un atractivo turístico para los visitantes. Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Braulia, Berenice y Sonia ellas invertirán en la compra de insumos para cultivo de flor de noche buena y para la compra de artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Verónica has been a member of this group for several loan cycles and says that she has noticed improvements in her business over the years as a result of the loans she has taken out.  She says: "When I started working with the financial institution I only had one greenhouse.  Now I have 10 because I have put a lot of effort into growing my business".  Verónica has been growing and selling poinsettias wholesale for 12 years.  She says that her best months in terms of sales are October to December and that she grows different varieties of poinsettia.  She says that her husband sells the plants in the State of Mexico and that she grows more than 7,000 plants each season.  As a result she has enjoyed good sales.

Verónica is gradually building her home from concrete as her previous home was built from wood.  "Although my work is very hard, it is very satisfying to see my customers when they leave with a happy smile on their faces because my flowers are such good quality".  Vero, as she is known in her community, is requesting a loan to buy plant pots, soil and fertilizers because the growing season has just started and she needs the plant pots to start  dividing up the poinsettia cuttings that she will begin growing.  She says that she invites people to come and buy from her or visit her nurseries which are also a tourist attraction.

The other three members of this group are called Braulia, Berenice and Sonia.  They will invest their loans in buying supplies for growing poinsettias and items with which to stock a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy plant pots, soil, fertilizers and insecticides for growing poinsettias

loans.name: Thiep

texts.en:
Thiep, age 67, is a rice farmer. She is the single mother of five children and lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Thiep owns farmland where she plants and harvests rice, some of which utilizes for food for the family and some of which she offers for sale in her neighborhood to earn a living. Her business is in a good location, as there is enough water supplying her crops to allow her to harvest her crops twice a year. She has been engaged in this enterprise for more than 30 years. 

Thiep is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 through HKL in order to celebrate a general religious ceremony with her fellow villagers and to pay for expenses incurred in preparation for the ceremony. She will use the rest of her loan funds to cover immediate costs of her family’s expenses. 

She plans to steadily expand her farming business so as to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to celebrate a general religious ceremony with her fellow villagers and to pay for expenses incurred in preparation for the ceremony

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, age 28, is a rice farmer in the Prey Chor district, where she lives together with her husband and two children. She earns an income by growing rice on approximately two hectares of farmland. Chan’s husband is employed as a driver for a local private school, earning about USD 8.00 per day. They pool their incomes to support their family. They aim to earn the highest income they can to ensure better living conditions for their children.

The home in which the family lives is old and in need of immediate repair, but Chan and her husband have insufficient funds for the necessary renovations. For this reason, she has applied for this loan. She will use the loan funds to buy construction materials needed for basic home improvements and to pay for labor costs. 

This loan will provide Chan and her family a suitable shelter in which to live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed for basic home improvements and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is from Malibangcao, Ozamis City. She is 69 years old, married, and has ten children. 

To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a retail store. She has had her business for five years and earns 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Pilar joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Mercilita

texts.en:
Mercelita, age 58 and widowed, is a banana farmer. She has four children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland on which she plants bananas, which she then harvests and offers for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns PhP 3,000 per month. 

Mercelita has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 4,500, which she will use to purchase chemicals for her banana production. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato tiene 51 años de edad, está casado con Cleofe y tiene 2 hijos con quienes reside en su vivienda construida a base de material noble .Posee un terreno agrícola en el cual se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico desde hace 30 años, anteriormente tenia por labor la crianza de reses pero según comenta le era muy difícil localizarlas cuando se extraviaban.Es uno de los pioneros en el uso de abono orgánico ya que después de su primera prueba obtuvo una buena calidad de mazorcas de cacao logrando así que otros agricultores usaran ese producto y como parte de la expansión de árboles de cacao desea adquirir una cantidad considerable de abono orgánico para garantizar una producción de calidad. Uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo es aperturar una tienda de productos comestibles en la zona urbana de su localidad para ocupar laboralmente a su esposa .Este es su primera experiencia en Kiva y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Con los S/.3,000 soles comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 51 years old, and he and his wife, Cleofe, live with their two children in their own home. Fortunato has dedicated the past 30 years of his life to organic cacao farming. Before settling into cacao farming, he raised and bred cattle, though it was challenging to locate and return cows to his herd that had strayed out of the pasture. 

As one of the pioneers of organic fertilizer and manure in his area, Fortunato has been quite pleased with the healthy results it yields in conjunction with his experienced farming techniques. He hopes that an increasing number of farmers will switch to organic manure and fertilizers in the near future. As he expands his farming operation, he requires more fertilizer for tending his cacao trees and producing a high-quality harvest. One of his long term goals is to open a small grocery store in the city center where his wife could work to generate additional income for their family.  This is his first loan, and he promises to make all scheduled repayments on time. Fortunato plans to use the support from this loan to purchase organic fertilizer for tending his cacao trees.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for tending his cacao crops.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta tiene 52 años de edad ,esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera.Edilberta se dedica a la compra , crianza y venta de ganados de manera artesanal , ella optó por incursionar en este rubro ya que no tenia el dinero suficiente para comprar un terreno agrícola.
Con la idea de su esposo y la necesidad de tener un ingreso para el sostén de su hogar se inicio con el cuidado de reses los cuales adquiere y posteriormente los vende a las carniceras del mercado en su localidad. Actualmente no cuenta con ganado disponible y por ello desea contar con un crédito que le permita anticipar su próximo pedido.Desea seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza y lograr la compra de un terreno para el libre pastado de sus animales puesto que actualmente lo realiza en áreas libres afueras de la ciudad. 
Siendo este su primer crédito con Kiva se muestra agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Desea contar con S/.3,000 soles para la compra de ganado que será traído de la sierra central para su respectiva crianza y posterior venta.
texts.en:
Edilberta is 52 years old and married. She has three children with whom she lives in her wooden house. Edilberta buys, raises and sells cattle by using artisan farming methods. She opted to start this business because she didn't have enough money to buy a plot of land. Because of an idea her husband had and out the need to have a source of income to support her household, she started raising cattle. She buys and then sells the cattle to butchers at the local market. She currently doesn't have cattle available and therefore she wishes to get a loan which allows her to place her next order in advance. She wishes to keen on working with the drive she's known for. She also wishes to be able to buy a plot of land so her animals can graze freely, since she currently uses the unoccupied areas in the outskirts of the town.
This is her first Kiva loan. She's thankful for the financial support she has gotten and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion. She wishes to get 3000 soles in order to purchase cattle, which will be brought in from the country's central highlands for being raised and then sold.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Elenita engages in cooking and selling of snack food in the local community to supplement her husband's income. She is 47 years old and has three school-age children. They aimed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. 

For this reason, Elenita plans to improve and strengthen her business to generate sufficient income. She is asking for a financial assistance of PHP 9000 to buy bananas, oils, sugar, vegetables, meat and other ingredients needed in cooking snack foods to sell. She believes that her loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oils, sugar, vegetables, meat and other ingredients needed in cooking snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es un joven de 27 años, quien es soltero y vive en  Sololá junto a su madre, y sus 5 hermanos (3 hombres y 2 mujeres). El actualmente elabora cortes típicos que son prendas que las mujeres utilizan en la comunidad donde vive. Los productos los vende en el mercado  de Sololá, con ello genera ingresos aceptables que le ayudan a aportar a la economía familiar. El tiene una experiencia de 8 años en esta labor,  la cual la  aprendió a través de unos amigos. Con el paso del tiempo el ha comprado poco a poco todas las herramientas necesarias para hacer este trabajo; El solicita un préstamo de Q, 3,000.00 para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de cortes típicos. Unos de  sus sueños es comprar una máquina industrial que le ayude a entregar los productos completos en menor tiempo y con mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Francisco is a young man of 27 years of age. He's single and lives in Sololá with his mother and his 5 siblings (3 brothers and 2 sisters). He currently weaves traditional garments, which are clothing worn by the women in the village where he lives. He sells his products in the market of Sololá, and that's how he earns acceptable profits which help him to contribute to his family's finances. He has 8 years' worth of experience in this line of work, which he learned from some of his friends. Over time, he has gradually acquired all the tools he needs to do this work. He requests a loan of 3000 quetzal in order to purchase supplies for making traditional garments. One of his dreams is to buy an industrial machine which helps him to deliver the completed products faster and with higher quality to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making traditional garments.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is married and a single mother of two grown-up children. San is one of Cambodia's Muslims who currently lives in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. At her age of 59, San is an industrious housewife, always taking care of her children and working for a healthy family. Her family’s income depends on her two children; her daughter, who is a garment worker, and her son, who provides tuk-tuk services around the city.

Due to insufficient capital for building a house, San is seeking a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), a long-standing Kiva partner, to buy needed materials for housing construction. Just for a suitable shelter, it is going to cost USD 1,500. This loan will help prevent her family from paying a higher rent for a room and will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy needed materials for housing construction.

loans.name: Ishumael

texts.en: Ishumael is an eighty-six-year-old dryland farmer. He grows maize and peas, and keeps goats and chickens. Ishumael has forty acres, which he would someday like to cover with trees. However, this season, he will be adding a second KOMAZA tree farm to his agricultural investments. Ishumael plans to use the profits from his tree farm to upgrade from his mud-walled home.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: This client, named Mao, is 31 years old and a resident living in a public gathering area of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She started doing farming when she was a teenage girl living with her parents. She has learned the methodology of operating the business for more than 10 years and she earns approximately USD 1.50 per day. Working around 8-10 hours at a construction site, Mao’s husband is able to make USD 5.00 a day to financially support their family and keep their two children in school. Mao’s husband is planning to work in Thailand for a better wage; however, he doesn’t have enough money to pay for a passport and also for traveling expenses. In this regard, Mao decided to borrow a loan through HKL to solve their financial problems and work out their plans. In the future, Mao dreams of having a nice house and giving her children good opportunities for education.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and also for traveling expenses.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba con su credikiva pasado incrementó sus ventas, por eso ahora tiene mas demanda de los articulos que ofrece y está cumpliendo a  los pedidos que hacen en muchos de los pueblos vecinos. Sin embargo desde otros municipios hay muchas solicitudes y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responderles, por eso acude una vez mas a su credikiva, con el cual aumentará el número de tanques metálicos y plásticos para obtener buenos precios y responder efectivamente a la demanda de su mercado.
texts.en: With her last Kiva loan Alba increased her sales, and for this reason she now has more demand for the articles she sells and is receiving orders from many neighboring town. Nevertheless there are many orders from neighboring towns and her working capital is not sufficient to meet them. For this reason she is asking for another Kiva loan, with which she will increase the number of metal and plastic tanks she has to obtain good prices and  successfully respond to the demand for her goods.

loans.use: to buy metal and plastic tanks to sell in neighboring towns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put down ceramic floor tiles.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: This time, for her fourth cycle loan, Arsenia is requesting a loan Php 14000 in order to fund her rope-making business.  This business was previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF and it continues to provide Arsenia and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 61 years-old and widowed with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a banana farm. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns PHp19,000 every month. 

In 2009, she joined Kiva partner GDMPC and she is now requesting a loan of PHp21,500 in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use 
the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the structure of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building his home.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantuya, 52 years-old, lives with her father, sister and son in Erdenet the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). Her father is retired and receives a state pension. Her younger sister has been working at a private business since 2007 and, from 2013, she has been promoted to the position of accountant. Mrs. Gantuya herself has been working as a chemistry teacher at a school for 29 years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her son is unemployed and now stays at home. 

Even though the family owns a house next to their traditional Mongolian ger, they don't live in their house because the house has deteriorated over the years. The interior walls and windows have became so fragile they do not protect the family from incoming storms and frosts. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,700,000 MNT in order to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, cotton, foam, bricks, cement and planks. Using these materials, she can make an extension to her house and insulate the interior walls and windows. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una señora  de 29 años,  es madre soltera y  vive en Sololá. Ella tiene dos hijos un varón de 10 años y una nena de 8 años, ellos están estudiando. 
Ella se dedica a la venta  de frutas preparadas,  que son colocadas en bandejas y de esta forma sale a ofrecer  en las oficinas, tiendas, juzgados etc. Ella empezó este pequeño negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos a raíz de la  separación con su pareja. Ella lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y de esta manera salir adelante también como mujer.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo y así ampliar su negocio de frutas, mejorando su  ingreso y  el servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es construir una casa propia para ella y sus hijos ya que por el momento están alquilando  la casa donde viven.
texts.en:
Ana is a 29-year old woman.  She is a single mother and lives in Sololá.  She has two children, a 10-year old son and a little girl who is 8 years old.  They both go to school.
Ana makes her living selling prepared fruit.  She puts the fruit in trays and offers it for sale at offices, stores, the courts etc.  She started this small business out of a need to support her children after she separated from her partner.  She works hard to ensure her children's well-being and to get ahead as a woman. 
Ana is requesting a loan of Q 3,000.00 (USD $400) for working capital to expand her fruit-selling business.  She wants to improve her income and the service she offers to her customers. 
Ana's dream is to build her own home, for herself and her children.  For now, they live in a rented house.

loans.use: with working capital to expand her fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is from Samraong Tong district, Kompong Speu province of Cambodia. She lives together with her spouse and two unmarried children.  The rest of her children have settled down and started their own families. Hang and her spouse are in the same business.  They cultivate a few plots of farmland in order to make their livelihoods. Instead of being free at home, Hang has also tried to involve herself selling Khmer cakes for additional profit. In the same manner, Hang’s husband devotes his spare time to trading potatoes and palm juice as a wholesale business. The difficulty he has experienced in his business is that he does not have a motorcycle to appropriately transport his products. 

To compete against the challenge, Hang would like to acquire a loan amounting to USD 1,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle to support the current business of her husband. She believes that the loan will have a positive impact toward the achievement of their goals and allow them to move their family forward.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support the current business of her husband.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Cheam is a 40-year-old woman who is married and has five children. Together they live in a small village of Prey Chor district, where she began farming as her primary source of income. Having been doing this occupation for years, Cheam is very confident of handling and managing her business with great support from her husband and children. She normally generates at least KHR 5,000 per day and she intends to make it more viable and profitable as she tries hard to expand her business in the years to come.

Cheam has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 in order to cover the cost of land which she will rent to grow rice. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and thereby increase her main income. In the future, Cheam will attempt to escape from poverty and to secure the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of land which she will rent to grow rice.

loans.name: Rita Frances

texts.en: Rita is a widowed woman from Cabagan with two children. She is engaged in making and selling frozen foods. She wants to expand her business, however she lacks the financial resources to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, and hamburger patties for her business. With this, she will be able to make and sell more frozen foods.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, and hamburger patties for her business.

loans.name: Pheary's Group

texts.en:
Pheary, 39, is a rural villager from Pursat Province. She has three children under her care as they are still in school. Rice farming on two hectares of farmland and pig raising are the main sources of income for her family. She has been with this business for 30 years and is able to earn up to 21,000 riels. 

Pheary has taken out loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) four times including this cycle. She has completely paid back her past loan, which has better supported her living as well as her business – especially her pig-raising business. In need of working capital, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income in order to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash for farmland

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 51 years old and is engaged in selling fish as a source of income. She has been doing this for almost eleven years and earns 5,000 PHP every month, which is not enough to cover her growing necessities. Mildred is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fish to resell. She hopes this will help to increase her income. After all, she is doing her best to provide a better income and standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is 50 years of age, married and a business-oriented person. He offers rice, eggs, cooking ingredients and fish sauce at the public market. He is thankful because he is able to dispose of his rice immediately. With the smooth flow of his business, he plans to increase the number of sacks of rice he offers but he doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000.He will be using this loan in buying additional bags of rice to be sold. He hopes that he could expand his rice retailing business, enabling him to earn greater income and improve his way of living. Wilfredo believes that his hard work and perseverance will enable him to fulfill his dream in life.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice for sale

loans.name: Chaylem's Group

texts.en: Chaylem, 32, lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moungkol Borey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, she and her husband earn a living as teachers in the local area. They have been in this job for several years.This is Chaylem’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group has only three members, all of whom have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. She and her members completely paid back the past loans from VisionFund, and Chaylem has used the loans to improve her family’s standard of living in a gradual manner. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Chaylem is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to fix her house on time so she does not need to worry about unpredictable weather issue, including too dry or rain.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret, 48, lives in a rural village in the Kror Kor district. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers, and she has been in this business for 28 years. She is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saret has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past two loans, which she has repaid, have helped her relieve the financial burden and improve her livelihood. 

The group is now requesting a new loan.  Saret, the group leader, will use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for commuting in her family. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent motor to use.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting in her family

loans.name: Savoet's Group

texts.en: Savoet, 33, is married with two dependent children who are both still in school. Her family lives in a house with thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Sangke district, and the main source of her family’s income is working for others for a fee. She and her husband has been with this job for ten years, earning about KHR 26,000 per day; she is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day. Savoert received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, and support her family’s needs.  Now, she wants to start another small scale business, rice trading. Therefore, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan.As the the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy 15 sacks of rice to stock for resale when the price is high. She hopes this business will double her income so that she can upgrade her lifestyle better than before .

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice to stock for resale

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
Sarou, 48, lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming rice for ten years. To complement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day, but she can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sarou is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en: Saveth is 42 years old and the married mother of five children. Her family lives in Pursat Province. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice and raises pigs as the main source of income. This 20 years of experience in this business generates about 18,700 KHR per day to support her standard of living. She is the group leader in the group of three. Saveth is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), while one of her co-borrowers is a six cycle client and another one is a third cycle client. Now, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR.  Saveth, whose loan portion is 200,000 KHR, will use her loan to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice. She hopes that growing more rice in her business will allow her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice.

loans.name: Keb

texts.en:
Keb is a resident of Prey Chor district, which is a central district of Kompong Cham surrounded by other Kompong Cham districts. Local people of the region rely on agribusiness and commercial trade. As other villagers, Keb, aged 38, owns and manages a farming business as a major source of her income. To help contribute to the development of their living standard, Keb’s husband works to provide cooking services especially for parties and religious ceremonies around the province.

Keb would like to make some home improvements and is taking out a loan in the amount of USD 1,000 in order to build kitchen shelves and to connect the household to electricity. She believes that her family will be satisfied and live more comfortably with the loan outcome. Her dream is to keep growing her business and educate her four children.

loans.use: to build kitchen shelves and to connect the household to electricity.

loans.name: Peach's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old mother of three kids residing in Battambang province, Peach is married and is one of the villagers who grow rice as their primary source of income. To help her in earning more income, her husband also has another job as the cooking chef during wedding ceremonies. This 10 years' engagement in her current business has provided Peach with about 26,700 KHR as her daily income. 

Peach is a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, her living standard is better than before which is owing to a positive outcome of her past loans; she also fully repaid her past loans with success. 

Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. She is the group leader and will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees. She really hopes that she can earn more income and upgrade her living standard constantly.

loans.use: To pay plowing fee

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Originally from a rural village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sokun is a 45-year-old married mother of four children. Two of her four children are still financially dependent as they are students in the local state school. Rice farming has been the main source of income for her family for seven years. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works for others for a fee. Sokun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles. She successfully used past loans to better support her entire family, especially to cover her children’s education. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to grow her healthy rice to earn more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is 49 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham province. She has three children, including one son who still counts on her as her son and is still in school. 

To strive for a living, Soeurn does rice cropping on three hectares of farmland and works for others for extra income. This 27-year engagement in the current business has returned her approximately 19,900 KHR per day, of which 13,500 KHR is her saving portion after deducting expenses. 

This is Soeurn’s fourth cycle loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has managed her past loan wisely to improve her livelihood and keep her children in school. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash for her cash-crop. Soeurn hopes this purchase will boost her output on a larger scale and sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy potash for her cash-crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn, a rural villager residing in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, is married and blessed with three children. All of them are still under her dependency, since two are school children while a remaining one is an invalid. The main incomes are solely from Sivorn's occupation as a garment factory worker and her husband’s job as a construction worker. The current main challenge for Sivorn's family is the low condition of her house. 

To overcome this challenge, she has reapplied for a new loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Sivorn has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles. She has managed her past loan properly, to upgrade her lifestyle. 

For this new cycle, Sivorn will use her loan portion to fix her house. She hopes the loan will help her to renovate her house on time, so she does not need to worry about her house condition during either the upcoming dry season or rainy season.

loans.use: to fix her house.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Residing in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Touch is 45 and married. She has four children, two of whom still dependent on her since they are students at the local state school.  

To support this huge family, she been farming on a half hectare area, which she has been doing for 21 years. To better feed the family, her husband also uses his spare time to work for others for a fee.  

Touch has been a member of Kiva’s partner for three cycles, and she has used her past loans successfully to better support her family and keep her children in school.   

Now she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); Touch will use it to build a new concrete kitchen. She hopes this loan will enable her to build her kitchen on time so she can have a hygenic place to cook clean food for her children and have better health in the family.

loans.use: To build a new concrete kitchen.

loans.name: Samul

texts.en:
Samul, a rural villager from Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, is 29 years old and is married. She has two children who solely rely on her as they are still in school.  

To feed her family, Samul grows rice and sells vegetables. This is her family's primary source of income. Her husband works as a paid worker for extra income. Samul has been in this business for 10 years. 

Samul has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is applying for her first loan in order to buy a plot of farmland to expand her business. She hopes to increase her income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland on which to grow rice and vegetables.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is a citizen from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, where rice farming is the common business among her neighborhood. She is 50 years old, and is a married mother blessed with seven children. Of her seven children, only two sons are still under her dependency, with one being in school and the other is under-aged for schooling. 

Just like her neighbors, Ry cultivates rice as well as growing potatoes. Her husband is the main human power helping her on the field. This couple also uses their spare time to earn extra income, through working for others for a fee, for the sake of their children. The current business, which she has been in for 26 years, returns her about 30,900 KHR per day and, of which she saves about 22,900 KHR per day.

This is Ry's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can get a high yield from both her cash-crops, and earn more income so that she can set aside more money to buy a mini tractor to support her business.

loans.use: to buy potash and to pay for labor costs for her rice and potato growing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ma. Rachel

texts.en:
Ma. Rachel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, vinegar, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Rachel has been in this business for one year. Ma. Rachel earns additional income from raising livestock.

Ma. Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, vinegar, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio’s business provides for his family’s daily expenditures. For eight years, he has been in the business of selling wood and he wishes to increase his usual profit. He would be able to do this if he had stable funds to use. To make it possible, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to buy more wood to sell. He hopes that his wish to increase his sales will soon be achieved.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 37 years old and married with four children.

Rosana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of rice and goods to sell in her store.

Rosana has borrowed and paid two previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear, raising livestock and retailing rice.

Rosana aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Teresa. She operates a used clothing store and previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of used clothes and other products to expand her inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the personal, household, and business expenditures of her family.

Ma. Teresa is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes and other products. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. Ma. Teresa looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Teresa dreams that her business will grow and she hopes to have a good life. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to stock of used but quality clothes and other products

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Sam is aged 48 and is married with five children. They live in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one hectare while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income. 

Sam is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sam has just joined Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Sam, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em, an elderly father of nine children, is 58 years old and a local farmer who grows rice as the primary source of income. He can make additional through leasing a speaker as a paid-service. This 34-year-old business brings him about 19,500 KHR per day. Em, a fifth time borrower, forms a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid back his past loan which has better supported his business and helped it to make good progress. Now, he is seeking for a new loan in order to buy a decent motorbike to support his living as well as his business. He hopes this motorbike will relieve his burden related to transportation expenses so he can set aside some money for his future needs and for the sake of his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to support his living as well as his business.

loans.name: Tean's Group

texts.en:
Tean, 51, is a local inhabitant from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She has six children only one of whom still counts on her as he is still in school. She and her husband have only one primary source of income, rice farming. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for ages. 

Tean has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Her previous loan has helped her to upgrade her living gradually; she also finally can manage to repay her loan successfully as well. 

For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her fellow group member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to renovate her kitchen. She hopes to own a proper kitchen for her family so that she can provide decent and clean food for her kid.

loans.use: To renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur and has three people living in his house, including his only son (as you can see in the picture). 

Agus joined Ruma more than two years ago because he wants to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Agus has had around $121/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif runs a small stall known as Daffa Cell where he sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits, and services bill payments for his customers. He is an entrepreneur and has three people living in his house including his six-year-old son. He joined Ruma a year ago because he wanted to expand to other business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credit. For the last three months, he has around $30 - $70 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Dwi runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits, and also services bill payments for customers. She is an entrepreneur, while her husband works as a salesman. She has three people living in her house, including her 2-year-old daughter.
