Dwi joined Ruma eight months ago because she wanted to expand into other business opportunities through selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Dwi has had around $30-$50/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs well, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Renan

texts.en:
Renan is a 37-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  He is still single and he works hard to provide income for his everyday needs.  He is also financially assisting his parents and siblings.  Renan operates a junk shop.  

Since trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags while waiting for their local dump trucks.  They scavenge for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials.  They sell these to junk shops like Joey’s for a little profit.  Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries such as factories.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan.  He will be incorporating the loan with his current revolving fund, which is used to buy trash from collectors.  He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Renan hopes that his business will continue to grow and he dreams that his family will have a good life.  He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and to draw strength from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Arnielyn

texts.en: Arnelyn is married and has two children. She is 28 years-old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She cultivates mangoes and plants vegetables (particularly eggplant) in order to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns about PHp8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHp10,000 in order to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She's been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Arnelyn hopes to improve her business so that she can have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Alita has been in this business for one year. Alita earns additional income from a general store.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Fe is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell for her general store

loans.name: Chairul

texts.en:
Chairul is a student who sells mobile phone airtime credits. He still lives in his parents’ house with three people living in the house. He joined Ruma five and a half months ago because he got interested in having additional income and feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for the customers. 

For the last three months, he has around $70 - $100 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Dianning

texts.en:
Dianning runs small permanent stall which sells snacks, drinks, children's toys, mobile phone airtime credits, and also serves bill payment for the customers. She is an entrepreneur and has four people living in her house, including her wonderful teenager twin daughters. She joined Ruma 10 months ago because she wanted to increase her income and feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for the customers. 

For the last 3 months, Dianning has around $70 - $80 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business keeps running, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Imas

texts.en: Imas runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits. She is an entrepreneur and has three people living in her house including her only two-year-old daughter. She joined Ruma 11 months ago because she wanted to have additional income and feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone air time credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, she has around $20 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs more working capital to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on the weekend

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en:
Rainer is married and has two children. He is 37 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Rainer owns and manages a sari-sari store to earn a living. He has had this business for 15 years. Each month he earns PHP 9,000 doing this work.

He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase new items to sell, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps and canned goods. Rainer has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. Rainer hopes to expand his sari-sari store in the future, to sustain his family's daily needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps and canned goods

loans.name: Mahpudin

texts.en: Mahpudin runs a small stall, which sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepeneur and has three persons living in his house. He joined Ruma four months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He still feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $70 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs more working capital to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Consolita

texts.en:
Consolita is 63 years-old and married with four children.

Consolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Consolita has borrowed and repaid 29 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from a general store and selling brooms.

Consolita aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jereil

texts.en: Jereil lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been making her living by providing transportation services for three years, to support her child. For this 28-year old mother, nothing would make her more happy than seeing her child successful at school. Jeriel gets an income of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from her business. She joined GDMPC this year and has borrowed 15,000 PHP to repair the vehicle used in her business. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of items such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, and cooking oil for her kiosk.

loans.name: Norng

texts.en:
Aged 58 years, Norng is a single woman living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer for 30 years. Norng is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day but she can save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
This is the sixth loan for Norng with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan of 3,000,000 KHR with VisionFund and she is going to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice successfuly so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila runs a sari-sari (variety) store in her place in Getafe, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 15 years. Her husband works as a carpenter.
 
Cirila is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to resell in her store, like canned goods, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and other items. With these purchases, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.

Cirila has hopes of making her business a success, and sustainable into the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children, and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to resell, like canned goods, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for making tombstones (lapida) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more materials used for his motorcycle repair business (motor parts, tools)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos is a 34 year old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has one son. Carlos is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve his business, the farm and the harvest. In the future, Carlos hopes to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds, vaccines and supplements

loans.name: Bat-Ulzii

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Ulzii, 36 years old, has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Before providing the taxi service, he was driving a bus for three years at a private transportation entity. He is divorced and his only son now lives with his wife separately from him. Using his previous loan, he repaired his automobile which he uses for the taxi service and paid each installment debt on schedule without delay. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a television and a bed. Purchasing these items will certainly improve his living standard. In particular, a comfortable bed will enable him to sleep well. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his son and contributes to his son's education by remitting money.

loans.use: to purchase a television and bed

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and married with one daughter. To support her family, she and her husband have been buying and selling garbage for three years and sometime they work as paid workers in the local area to earn extra income. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Navy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid the past loans which have helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for another loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Navy wants to use her portion to buy garbage to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy garbage to resell

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano is a 60-year-old married man with six children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sinforiano has a business buying and selling seaweed in the Philippines. Sinforiano requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more seaweed to sell.

Sinforiano has been in this business for nine years. Sinforiano would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 55 años de edad, esta casada con Pedro con quien tiene 7 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Ahora solo vive con su esposo en la casa que compraron hace 40 años.  
Desde joven aprendió a trabajar en la tierra, comenta que a temprana edad formó su familia, por lo que tuvo que comenzar a trabajar en la siembra de papa, maíz, habas y demás alimentos propios de la zona. Los terrenos agrícolas de extensas áreas que posee los adquirió de la herencia de sus padres. Es así que en cada cosecha, comercializa sus alimentos en el mercado de su localidad ya que son conocidos por la producción de maíz orgánico . Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos, pues su principal dificultad es el idioma, ya que habla Quechua y eso le dificulta negociar sus cosechas. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio ,por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Faustina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Faustina, 55, is married to Pedro with whom she has seven children, all of whom are independent adults. She presently lives with just her husband in the home that they bought 40 years ago.

Since she was young, she learned to work in the field. She says that at an early age she started her family, so she had to begin working in the harvest of potato, corn, beans, and the other plants typical of the area. She inherited the extensive area of agricultural land that she possesses from her parents. It is in this way that in each harvest she sells her produce in the market of her locality, since she is known for growing organic corn. Now she wants to improve her income, as her main difficulty in negotiating her harvests is language since she speaks Quechua. This is her first loan with Kiva; she is grateful for the opportunity that they're offering her since she will be able to improve her business. For this reason, she promises to be timely with her installment payments. Faustina will invest the money in purchasing organic fertilizer to enrich her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Herminda continúa con su negocio de pulpería apoyada por su pareja e hijos quienes la apoyan en todo y juntos salen adelante, sus créditos con Afodenic y Kiva lo ha utilizado invirtiéndole a su negocio, lo que le ha permitido mejorar su economía por lo que está muy agradecida, en esta ocasión desea invertir nuevamente en productos como granos básicos, enlatados, lácteos, gaseosas y productos nuevos para ofrecerle variedad a su clientela.
texts.en: Herminda continues to run her grocery store business, supported by her partner and children who help her with everything and together they get ahead. She has used her loans from AFODENIC and Kiva to invest in her business, which has allowed her to improve her finances for which she is very grateful. On this occasion, she wants to once again invest in products such as bulk grains, canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, and new products in order to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, and new products.

loans.name: Soey's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Battambang province’s Sangke district, Soey is 49 and married with two children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. For more than ten years, she has been selling snacks while her husband is a motor taxi driver to help his family. 

Soey has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living conditions better. Now, she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, Soey will use her portion to buy potatoes and beans to make snacks. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and beans to make snacks.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Originally from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham Province, Oun is a local farmer who solely depends on planting two types of crops, rice and cassava. She can earn more income through working for others for a fee. This is the business that she has been doing for 15 years and she is able to earn up to 41,000 KHR per day. A third-time borrower, Oun is in a group of two composing of two female members to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After her last successful loan, she feels confident that she can upgrade her lifestyle gradually better than before. Now, she wants to expand her agriculture business and boost her crop production through potash purchasing. Therefore, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR for this cycle to serve the above purpose while her joint member is seeking 1,100,000 KHR. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to enlargen her cash-crop growing farmland and return her a good yield with high profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахору 46 лет. Она добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее старшая дочь замужем и имеет ребенка. Итак, Гулбахор хорошая бабушка. Муж Гулбахора плотник и его зарплата не хватает для улучшения условия проживания, так как они живут бедно. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота, так как ее дом большой и имеет огород, где можно выращивать сено для скота. Ее дети будут помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат, что она может организовать бизнес и успешно управлять им. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей организовать бизнес и найти источника дохода, которому очень нуждается ее семья.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 46 years old.  She is a kind woman with a zest for life.  She is married and raising three children.  Her oldest daughter is married and has a child.  Gulbahor is a good grandmother.

Gulbahor's husband is a carpenter. His salary is not enough to improve the family's living conditions, which is why they are living in poverty.  

Gulbahor wants to start her own business, buying and selling livestock.  They have a big house with a vegetable garden where she could grow hay for the livestock.  Her children intend to help her with the business.

Gulbahor has completed a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she has received a certificate which makes it possible for her to start and successfully manage a new business.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy some livestock, and is awaiting your kindness.  This loan will help her to start her business and to find a much needed source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Palomitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMITAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nemesia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de batidos, venta de ropa de adulto, venta de ropa interior y joyas, ambulante, venta de helado, venta de medicina natural, venta de cosméticos, venta de sombreros y gorras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nemesia es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermano que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace mas de diez años por recomendación de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras  mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones en crédito.
texts.en:
The community bank "Palomitas Blancas" will start its thirteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Center of the Andes. It is comprised of nine members and directed by a board of directors, of which Nemesia is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank bring forward are various; among them are: milkshake sales, adult clothing sales, under garment and jewelry sales, ice cream sales, natural medicine sales, cosmetics sales, and hat sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses where Nemesia is a member. She said that nine years ago she joined Pro Mujer, by the invitation of her sister, who is an associate of the institution. Currently she has a business selling clothes. She says that she learned this business more than ten years ago by her mother's recommendation. 

The loan that she will take out now is for the increase of capital (purchase of clothing), that she will acquire from wholesale vendors, and later she will sell it at her stand. This form of working allows her to generate resources to maintain her home, as she lives with someone and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the trainings about loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina, 54, is married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She raises pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined in GDMPC since the year 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pig-raising business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.ru: Маниже 38 лет. Она замужем за милиционера и имеет 3 детей. Она родилась и выросла в столице. После окончания Таджикского Национального Университета она поступила на работу бухгалтером в транспортной организации. Манижа и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и успешно строили карьеру. Старший сын Мнижи, Алишер учится в Китае. Он студент 1 курса. Манижа должна оплатить за учебу сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Manizha is 38 years old.  She is married to a police officer and has three children.  She was born and grew up in Dushanbe.  After graduating from the Tajik National University, she started to work as an accountant for a transportation company.

Manizha and her husband do everything they can so that their children receive a higher education and then successfully build their careers.  Manizha's eldest son, Alisher, is currently studying in China where he is a first-year student.  Manizha needs to pay his tuition costs, but she does not have enough money to do so.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 dollars to pay her son's tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition.

loans.name: Victorino Asuncion

texts.es: Victorino Asunción de 61 años de edad casado con 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 12 años de edad todos estudian, originarios del municipio de Chinandega, el cual está ubicado en el occidente del país y se caracteriza por ser una zona muy productiva en el comercio,  Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general desde hace más de 14 años, en el que consiste en la compra de venta de sandalias, ropa de adultos, cosméticos, chinerías, adornos, productos plásticos, retrateras, relojes grandes, espejos pequeños entre otros, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como: comprara pantalones, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y toallas entre otros y así  mejorar la calidad de sus productos que ofrece a su clientela, y  de este modo planea obtener mayores ingresos al momento de comercializarlos, Victorino  es una persona luchadora que a pesar de su edad el da el todo por el todo por su familia, él está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo que ellos les brindan a las personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Victorino Asunción, 61, is married and has 3 children aged 13, 10 and 12 who are in school.  They are natives of the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country and is known for being a very productive commercial area.

For more than 14 years, Victorino has been selling general merchandise such as sandals, adult clothing, cosmetics, trinkets, decorative items, plastic products, picture frames, big watches, small mirrors, and other items.  He will use this loan to invest in working capital and to stock up his general merchandise business by purchasing pants, shoes, cosmetics, bed sheets, towels, and other items.  This way, he can improve the quality of the products that he offers his customers and thereby obtain more income when he sells the products.  

Victorino is a tenacious person who, in spite of his age, gives his utmost for his family.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support that they are providing to low-income people.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, plastic items, clothing for adults, cosmetics, trinkets, and other products

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуне 21 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж врач и очень хорошо относится своей семье. Мавзуна получила среднее специальное образование парикмахера. Она более чем 1 года работает парикмахером. Она имеет свой парикмахерский мини салон, где преподносит услуги парикмахера, как стрижка волос, укладка волос, покраска волос, разные прически, макияж. Она имеет своих клиентов и благодаря хорошему сервису ее клиенты не однократно посещают ее салон. Она хочет развивать бизнес дальше и получить больше дохода. Она для развития своего бизнеса должна купить новые приборы, как фен, набор расчесок, а также различные краски. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки необходимых приборов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is 21 years old.  She is married, with no children.  Her husband is a physician who gets along very well with her own family.

Mavzuna graduated from a vocational high school, specializing in hairdressing.  She has now been working as a hairdresser for more than a year.  She owns a mini-salon, where she offers services such as hair cutting, hair styling and hair dyeing.  She can do many hairdos and also does make-up.  She has her own clientele, and thanks to the quality of her work, her customers visit her salon more than once.

Mavzuna wants to further develop her business and to make a larger income.  In order to develop her business, she needs to buy some new equipment: a hair dryer, an assortment of combs and various hair dyes.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy some essential equipment.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang is 42 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker. Vang lives together with his spouse and children in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. Vang and his wife work together in an agricultural business, growing rice on a few pieces of farmland they inherited from their parents. They have been doing this type of business for more than 20 years.

Vang has borrowed two times in the past from HKL, to solve his financial problems and sustain his business. And now, he has come to the HKL office again, to take out another loan that he will use to buy construction materials. He will use them to build a house for his eldest child, who is already engaged to be married soon. In the future, Vang would like to save enough money to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a house for his eldest child.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He currently lives with his spouse and children in Kompong Speu province. Kang’s focused business activities are growing and harvesting rice to sell to local traders. He has been doing this business for over 20 years and earns a decent income, which goes for meals and school allowances for his children. For additional income, Kang harvests a kind of water lily plant, with a long, edible stalk, to sell in a market of his area. He would like to keep making his businesses profitable and have a sustainable income, for the overall welfare of his family.

With this loan, he is buying floorboards to fill in the blank space of his house, as it is now under construction. It will be a very comfortable place for members of his family. He is pleased to have this loan, which enables him to develop his living standard.

loans.use: to buy floorboards to fill in the blank space of his house, as it is now under construction.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim is a local farmer from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She lives in a thatched-roof house, with her family, including five children. Out of her five children, she needs to support only three. Two of the dependent children are still in school, while the remaining one is still too young for schooling. Lim does her rice cropping business on a two-hectare area, which she has been working for 13 years. This work earns her about 23,600 KHR per day.

This is the third microloan for Lim and her co-borrower in the same group of two, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels confident that she can move her family’s living status toward an upward trend, better than before. Now, her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR, whereas her fellow group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Lim will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for plowing her land. She highly expects that she can gain double yield compared to before, and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for plowing her land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pek's Group

texts.en: Pek, 41, is a mother of six children living in Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district.  Two of her children are still in school. She weaves palm tree leaves, the material which the rural people use to cover their house as a roof, as her primary source of income. To better feed her family, her husband works as a home builder. Her current business earns her about 9,900 KHR per day. Pek has never been a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to renovate her home. She hopes that his loan will allow her to provide a decent home for her kids.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun is 35 years old and  lives with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district in Battambang province. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have struggled but managed to feed and care for their children by farming rice and planting corn. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day.
Soun has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the previous loans. Soun wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve the family’s financial burden. Now she is asking for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her cultivated land. She hopes to grow her rice and corn healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her cultivated land.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 32 years old and married with a child who is attending school. He dedicates himself to farming, working around 8 hours a day during harvest season. He has been farming for almost 8 years on his own farm where he mainly grows rice for consumption. San also takes time to work in the construction industry to supplement his wages.

This loan that he needs will permit him to buy a motorcycle for personal use, buy a cow, and for the maintenance of the rice field. He says this loan would allow him and his family members better transportation and help increase his rice output. Having many years of experience, San dreams to have enough building tools and laborers to begin a construction project for himself. He believes that he can provide a better quality of life for his family by strengthening the business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal purpose, buy a cow, and for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Poch is a 49-year-old mother of eleven children, five of whom are still dependent on her and still in school. To support her big family, she has been struggling to feed her children by farming rice for 31 years. To supplement her income, her husband is a labourer. 
This is the sixth loan for Poch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old home. She hopes to earn a high crop yield from her rice paddy and also hopes to have a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 47 years old and is an industrious mother of three children. She lives with her husband and two children in Samraong Tong district of Kompong Speu province. Meas began farming to help the family earn more income. Despite her hardships at the rice paddy, Meas wishes to provide and maintain her healthy family by being a responsible housewife and farmer.

This is the first loan she received from HKL and she has never had other loans with state banks. She is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle for her home use and will use it for transporting her children around so they don't have to pay transport fees. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to save more for the future of her family and business. She hopes that someday, her business will grow and become a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбубе 34 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Она живет с родителями и старается помочь своим родителям. Махбуба несколько раз старалась организовать свой бизнес, но у неё не получалась. Она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила много новой информации о бизнесе. Она получила сертификат. Махбуба хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как она живет в сельской местности и имеет хорошею условию для скотоводства. Она будет покупать скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке по более высокой цене. Она будет справляться с бизнесом сама. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba is 34 years old. She is divorced and does not have children. She lives with her parents and tries to help them. Mahbuba has tried to start her own business several times, but did not succeed. She has found out about the Achieve Success course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a lot of information about business. She has received a certificate. Mahbuba wants to start a business selling cattle because she lives in the rural area and has good conditions for animal husbandry. She will buy cattle, keep it for several months and then resell on the local market at a higher price. She will run the business herself. Mahbuba is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Mohniso

texts.ru: Мохнисо 27 лет. Она за мужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж солдат и находится в армии. Он будет служить 2 года. Итак, Мохнисо должна обеспечить себя сама. Она не имеет высшее образование и поэтому не может работать на престижных и высокооплачиваемых местах. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых женщин и получила сертификат, что она умеет организовать бизнес и развевать его. Она планирует организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, то есть купле продажей барана. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohniso is 27 years old. She is married, but does not have children. Her husband is a soldier and is in the army now. He will serve for two years. So Mohniso has to support herself. She does not have a higher education and that's why cannot work on prestigious and high paying jobs. She wants to start her own business and become successful in this field. Mohniso has taken an Achieve Success cource organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate showing that she can start and grow a business. She plans to organize a business selling cattle, particularly selling sheep. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to buy cattle. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Rosamery

texts.es:
Rosamery tiene 29 años de edad, está casada con Willington de 30 años y tiene un niño de 5 años , juntos viven en una casa construida a base de adobe .Rosamery se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico .Ganó experiencia desde niña, puesto que brindo apoyo en labores menores a sus padres por ser la principal fuente de ingreso que tenia su familia en aquel entonces ,con el paso de los años logro obtener un pequeño terreno agrícola el cual fue cedido por sus padres para el sustento de su propia familia. En está actividad se debe de brindar los cuidados necesarios a las plantaciones de cacao para así extraer buenas mazorcas las cuales seran vendidas en el mercado de su localidad pero para realizar este trabajo necesita contratar trabajadores del lugar quienes conocen mucho más de este negocio.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se muestra muy agradecida y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Requiere contar con S/.2,000 soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y proceder con la cosecha respectiva.
texts.en:
Rosamery is 29 years old. She is married to Willington, 30 and has a 5-year-old son. They all live together in a brick house. Rosamery grows organic cocoa, something she learned when she was a small girl while helping her parents with minor tasks. This activity was by then the family’s main source of income.

With time, Rosamery received a small piece of land from her parents, for supporting her family. This activity requires commitment to the cocoa plants, in order to obtain good pods and sell them in the local marketplace. For this, she needs to hire local workers who know much more about this business.

This is Rosamery’s first loan with Kiva. She is grateful and promises to pay the installments on time. The 2,000 soles [PEN] she is requesting will be used to hire local workers and start with the collection of the cocoa fruits.

loans.use: to hire local workers for her cocoa plantation.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 32 years old and has one child.  Cerelina is a widow and has one child who is in school.

Cerelina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Cerelina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for her livestock business.  Cerelina has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cerelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 41 years old, lives with her husband and children in Kherlen, eastern town of Mongolia.  She has been working as a cook at a  restaurant since 2011.  

Her family resides in their own house on a plot of land.  The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repairs.  During the winter time, the family chills down to their core so they decided to make an extension to the house in order to reduce heat loss.  In order to make the extension, she needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks and cement.  As a result, the family will burn less coal thus contributing to the effort to reduce air pollution.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
Yem is a 51-year-old mother of six children and earns a living through farming rice in the local area.  Out of her six children, she still has two children to take care of and they are still in school.  Yem and her husband have been in her business for nineteen years and the current business earns them about 60,000 KHR per day to feed the family.

Yem has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other members have been for five cycles.  Yem wisely and successfully used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business needs.  Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng is a 63-year-old inhabitant residing in Kompong Speu province. She is involved in land cultivation, working hard to gather a plentiful harvest on one and half hectare of farmland. She has been working in the agricultural sector for more than 30 years and it has been the main source of her family’s income so far. Teng would like to expand her agriculture activity, and thus boost her production in years to come. Due to inadequate capital, Teng has applied for a loan to purchase a cow to help work more efficiently and minimize the operating costs. The loan is very important for Teng to be able to cultivate more rice, which will significantly increase her income. In the future, Teng hopes to have a better quality of life and secure the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to help work her fields more efficiently and minimize the operating costs.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Savy is now 44 years old and married. She has six children, three who are dependents and are still in school. Savy and her husband are farmers and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for four years, they are able to make 30,000KHR daily and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day.
This is the eighth loan for Savy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it on water pumping. She hopes this loan will boost her rice plantation and also grow healthy crops to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for water pumping.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old, married and has one child who is in school. Elvira is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock such as cattle, chickens, pigs, etc.
Elvira has been buying and selling livestock for 11 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock such as cattle, chickens, and pigs.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son has turned 22 and is the loving father of a child.  He and his wife work together on their own farm in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia.  Together, they can earn a decent income to cover home expenses.  Son has been involved in farming for about five years.  In their eagerness to lift the family out of poverty, Son works full time at the construction site after harvest season while his wife has a position in a local garment factory.

Son is now requesting his first cycle loan because he needs to continue investing in the planting and cultivation of rice.  The loan will allow him to purchase a farm animal and to prepare the land.  He’s sure everything’s going to be better and he might have a fruitful crop yield from the planting.

loans.use: to purchase a farm animal and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Soknang

texts.en: Soknang, a young mother of two little kids, is a farmer originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She does rice cropping on two hectares of farmland as her main income source and raises pigs as supplementary income. In her three year engagement in the current business, she has been able to earn about 12,300 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Soknang with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. With this loan she will buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy-season crops. She hopes to gain more yield and make more income for her kid’s sake.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy-season crops.

loans.name: Milikije

texts.en:
Milikije is 42 years old and married with five children. She lives in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. Milikije makes a living by raising cows, and her husband does construction work. She started her business by selling milk in her neighborhood. “I am very pleased with this business because I have reduced my family’s expenses while increasing our income,” said Milikije.

She claims that she works a lot to support her family financially. Her life has been greatly improved and she is requesting a loan to buy another cow. This is Milikije's first loan. In the future she wants to expand her business and save for her childrens university expenses. She is aware that without Kiva lenders, her goal will be difficult to achieve. Milikije is very appreciative for the help.

loans.use: to buy another cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen is 52 years old and originally from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is married with five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband grow rice as the main source of the family’s income. They also supplement their income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for twenty-five years, they earn about 43,000 KHR per day and provide for the family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day.
Chen has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase crop yields to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en: A married mother of five children, Van is a local resident of Battambang province and earns a living through rice cropping on two hectares of land. Besides helping her on the farmland, her husband also works for others for a fee. She is able to earn up to 40,000 KHR per day from the rice cropping, which she has been doing for 25 years. This is the third microloan for Van’s group, consisting of three female members including her. She has repaid back her past loans with success which were used to increase yield for her rice and increase her income. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cash-crops. She hopes that she can earn more money for her kids’ sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash-crops.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old and married with four children.She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like coffee, cooking oil, powdered soap, bread, etc. in her general store.

Emelia has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like coffee, cooking oil, powdered soap, bread, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is aged 26 years and married with two children. Her family lives in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has been raising pigs while her husband is a taxi driver to earn additional income. Having been in this business for ten years, Chan and her husband can earn about 90,000 KHR per day, and they can manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Chan has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other member is just with VisionFund in this cycle. Now Chan is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner in the family of seven kids, Van is 61 years old and a widow. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows sugarcane and sells sweets. This is the business that she has been with for six years. Van, an eight time borrower, is in the same group as a four time borrower in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Her living status has upgraded steadily and getting better day by day. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 600,000 KHR. Van, as the group leader, will use her loan portion to pay a plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can earn triple income and support her family better than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah, who is 46 years old, lives in the southern part of Kosovo. He is married and raising three children between the ages of 12 and 8 years old. He works in construction. He is the main source of income for the family. His wife is a housewife and spends most of her time taking care of her home. 

Their house is very old, damaged and uncomfortable, and it needs immediate renovation work. Abdullah always wanted to have a comfortable home. His pay is only enough to support their family and they would like to improve their living conditions.

Abdullah is requesting a loan for the first time to repair the windows, doors and roof. With this loan, he will be able to improve their home for the family, and they will be able to live in a more comfortable environment. Abdullah is grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping to improve the family's living conditions and their standard of living.

loans.use: To repair the windows, doors and roof.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran, 52, is a local villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She manages a five hectare area for growing cassava, and her husband works for an NGO. With 10 years of experience in the current business, Ran is able to earn about 38,900 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for her group, which consists of two members. Her original loan has better supported her business at a good pace. Now, Ran and her joint borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Ran, as the group leader, will use her loan portion to pay for purchasing potash and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her crops fruitfully and maintain her living status in a good manner.

loans.use: To purchase potash and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb is age 32 years and she is a mother of two daughters who are still in school. She and her husband make a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland and from planting cassava on two hectares of farmland, which they have been in for two years. The current business earns them about 46,000 KHR per day.

This is the sixth loan for Chreb with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She repaid the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR with VisionFund to buy cassava seeds for her cassava business. She will spend a portion of it on plowing the field. Chreb hopes to make more crops and to sell them for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: To buy cassava seeds for her cassava business.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en: Eunice is a twenty-nine year old tailor and the mother of one child. The income she earns from tailoring is limited by low demand and few clients. She wants to join the KOMAZA micro-forestry program "so as to go hand-in-hand with the KOMAZA objective which is to improve the living standard." She aspires to be "a role model lady in society who will be in a position to meet my basic and secondary needs." With the profits from her tree farm, Eunice plans to purchase a new parcel of land as an investment.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Sovanney's Group

texts.en:
Age 38, Sovanney is married with four children living in the Moung Russey district of Battabang province. Currently, she needs to care for only three children as they are still in school. She is able to deal with the daily food consumption by selling Chinese noodle and managing her half hectare of cassava crop. To help her in earning more income, her husband works as a blacksmith. The current business has returned her about 31,900 KHR per day. 

In her group, there are four members, three second-cycle clients and one four-time borrower. She has succeeded in making good use of her loan to sustain her business, the same as her lifestyle. Now, she is a group leader. The total loan amount that her group is requesting is 4,000,000 KHR. Sovanney, whose loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR, will use her loan portion to buy gasoline for pumping water, pesticide, and to pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will help her to support her business over time and to get back a good yield.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for pumping water, pesticide, and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Roen is aged 61 years and married. She has four children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in the farming business for eight years. Beside this, they also raise cows to better support her field business. The current business earns her family about 25,700 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Roen’s group consists of two members, and they have been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Roen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 45 years old, has divorced his wife and lives in his sister's apartment. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. In 2011, he began working as an electrician at a private business entity. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase furniture such as a sofa, table and chair for his sister's home. As he lives in his sister's apartment, he thinks it's his responsibility to improve and support his sister's life. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his sister.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as a sofa, table and chairs.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, originally from Battambang province where her residential place is, is married and 45 years old. She has three children who still count on her as they are still students in the local school. To cover the cost of decent daily food, she grows pineapple as her main source of income. This is the business that she has been with for 18 years.

Including this cycle, this is the third loan for Sinat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has supported her business over time and improved her livelihood. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop production. She hopes to gain a high yield and get more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maku's Group

texts.en:
Maku is a 53-year-old widow and a mother of four grown children. She makes a living in the sale of tomatoes, onions, coconuts and charcoal. However, Maku lacks enough capital to buy large quantities of vegetables to meet her customers' demand. 

She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, "The trees KOMAZA is planting with farmers grow fast and will enable the farmers to get money when they mature".

With the profits from her tree farm, Maku plans to educate her grandchildren and use the coppices (which grow from the stumps of the harvested trees) as building material.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Medza's Group

texts.en:
Medza is a fifty-five-year-old mother of six children and a widow. She sells locally-brewed beer and does casual labor to earn money to support her children. She says she lacks the capital to make large quantities of the brew, and sometimes her supply runs out, so she misses out on potential income. 

Medza says, "I want to plant trees and get money like my other villagers who have joined KOMAZA." She plans to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children, three of whom are still in school, and to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 51 years old and married with twelve children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock. Evangeline is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to purchase a motorcycle in order to have an easy delivery of her charcoal and livestock supplies.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is a single. He lives with his entire family. He is a very ambitious person and a very hardworker. He is working as an auto mechanic, repairing vehicles. He also has another job in independent transportation. He transports different things depending on the needs of the clients. Mostly, he transports and delivers large household furniture and appliances for people to new homes or during moves.

Burim requested a loan to buy tires for his truck and new tools for his auto mechanic work. He is hoping to generate more income and to save for his future. He is very grateful for this opportunity!

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck and new tools for his auto mechanic work.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, 37, is married with three children.

Flordeliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, noodles, sugar and other items to sell in her general store.

Flordeliza has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns income from buying and selling gasoline.

Flordeliza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, noodles, sugar and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nelis Nohemy

texts.es:
La  señora Nelis de 35 años, vive con su esposo  en su casa de habitación en una colonia de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10  años a la venta de hamacas de hilo, hamacas de seda, sondalezas, mecates, cabuyas, hamacas de cabuyas etc.
Doña Nelis su negocio está ubicado en la orilla de la carretera panamericana, sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y pesonas que transitan por por la zona que le visitan de diferentes partes.
Doña Nelis está solicitando  el préstamo  para compra de más hamacas de seda, hilo, mecates, cabuyas, sondalezas, etc. para así tener mas variedad de productos que ofrecer a todos sus clientes, quiere comprar al por mayor para la temporada de semana santa porque es la época que más vende. 
Doña Nelis su sueño ampliar su negocio y fortalecerlo.
 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Nelis is 35 years old. She lives with her husband in her house in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. For 10 years she has been selling silk hammocks, thread hammocks, ropes, cords, pita fibers, pita fiber hammocks, etc.

Nelis's business is located on the edge of the Panamerican highway. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and people who are traveling in the area who are visiting from elsewhere.  

Nelis is asking for the loan to buy more hammocks made from silk, thread, cord, pita fiber, rope, etc., so she can have a wider variety of products to offer all of her customers. She wants to buy wholesale for the Holy Week season because that is when her sales are the highest.

Nelis' dream is to expand her business and fortify it.
 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2013.

loans.use: to buy hammocks made from silk, thread, cord, pita fibers, rope, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her grocery store. Her loan was also a big help in the education of her children. She also has an Internet Cafe which is where she wanted to focus on. She has been in this business for eight years now and it is continuously growing. She and her husband, who is a barangay (village) captain are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Grace dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en:
Vano is 47 years old. He lives in a small village near the Gardabani District with his wife and five children. Vano has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but has had no success. His loan requests were always rejected, due to his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is trading. In particular, Vano purchases iron at wholesale prices and then resells at a higher price. However, it is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vano requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved within the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the received credit Vano will purchase a milking cow so the family can produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Vano's family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Maribel tiene 50 años de edad, acompañada con tres hijos de 3, 18, 22 años de edad respectivamente, tiene 28 años dedicarse  a  la venta de verduras, frutas frescas y nacatamales, de ser clientes con la institución tiene 3 años respectivamente, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, frutas frescas como naranjas, piñas, guayaba para frescos, remolachas, zanahorias, mandarinas, jocotes, mangos, papaya, tamarindos, limón, banano, y materia prima para hacer nacatamales como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, arroz, papas, vegetales, naranja agria, mecates, sal, etc. Cindy tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Juana tiene 66 años de edad y su negocio es tener un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Maribel. She is 50 years old, married and has three children aged 3, 18 and 22. For 28 years she has been selling vegetables, fresh fruit and nacatamales. They have all been clients of the institution for 3 years each. Maribel will invest the loan in buying fresh fruit such as oranges, pineapples and guayaba for juices, as well as beets, carrots, tangerines, jocotes, mangos, papayas, tamarinds, lemons, bananas, and ingredients to make nacatamales such as pork, banana leaves, rice, vegetables, tart oranges, string, salt, etc. 

Cindy is 20 years old and her business is a convenience store in her house and Juana is 66 and her business is a small sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit such as oranges, pineapples, and guayabas for juices as well as beets, carrots, tangerines, jocotes, mangos, papayas, tamarinds, lemons, bananas,beets and ingredients to make nacatamales such as pork, banana leaves, rice, potatoes, vegetables, tart oranges, string, salt, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 66-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown children. She lives with her family in Loon, Bohol, in the Philippines. Erlinda has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 15 years now.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Erlinda hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en: Presentacion, who is 52 years old, is married with three children. She has had a fish-selling business for nearly 10 years. This business enables her to earn an income of PHP 1,000 weekly. She would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase fish to sell such as tilapia and bangus (milkfish). She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fish such as tilapia and bangus (milkfish) to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Bautista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER BAUTISTA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida y dulces, elaboración de prendas de vestir, venta de salchipapas, tejido de buzos de lana, tejido de mantas a máquina.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mery es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y dulces; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de paquetes de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras  mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones en crédito.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO AMANECER BAUTISTA” community bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Mery is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them we have: selling vegetables, selling food and candies, making clothing, selling salchipapas, knitting wool sweaters, machine knitting blankets. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-businesswomen, including Mery. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who visited her at her home. Right now, she has a business selling food and candies. She says that she learned this business on her own.
 
The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying packs of candy wholesale that she will acquire from wholesalers. Later she will sell them from her locale. This work allows her to generate income to support her home as much as possible, because she is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health portion and the credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy packs of candy wholesale.

loans.name: Lenchonghoi Lom Group

texts.en:
Chongboi says, “To raise five kids without a regular income is challenging when your husband serves as a pastor in a small village church.” Chongboi narrates the hardship she faces in managing the family's affairs. Chongboi is the featured borrower member of the Lenchonghoi Group. She is featured with her hand raised. She shares that it is lucky to be married to a pastor but not so lucky when it comes to running the family. 

Chongboi joined Lenchonghoi Group in the year 2009 and started earning money by engaging herself in piggery. Chongboi uses piggery as a main source of income for the family. She sells the fully grown pigs and then buys new piglets again to raise them. She is well experienced in piggery technique now. She sells the fully grown pigs in the village and neighbouring villages. She provides school fees, text-books, school uniforms, and study materials for all the five children and now she aspires to start a poultry business with a new loan.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy chicks and construct a chicken coop. She will ask her fellow member friend to teach her the practices to raise chickens (her friend's poultry is shown in the group photograph). She is excited and looking forward to the next loan. She sends all the lenders good wishes and thanks you.

The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, weaving, poultry and ginger farming. All the other members are also very hard working women and strive hard to lead an independent life.

loans.use: To pay for chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 33-year-old carpenter and a dry-land farmer. His carpentry business is inhibited by not having sufficient capital to buy timber and better tools. Emmanuel says, "I like doing tree farming and KOMAZA is helping farmers to realize their dream." With the profits from his KOMAZA tree farm, he plans to improve his workshop and buy modern tools.

loans.use: to buy eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizers and pay for training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarsaikhan, who is 45 years old, lives with her husband and younger daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband had a stroke and receives a disability pension from the state. Her daughter goes to a secondary high school. 

Bayarsaikhan has been running her clothing-sales business since 2009. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to import clothes from China. As a result, she will be able to continue running her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to import clothes from China.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hog-raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her hog-raising business.

Gina has been in this business for seven years. Gina earns additional income from a general store.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of buying a motorcycle to be used for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife and he works in agricultural from tradition. To support his family, he works hard. 

He raises cows and he sells milk in his neighborhood. In this way he earns a living. Fadil is able to support his family through his business. He also works with his tractor on agricultural land which he has possessed for a long time. 

Fadil now needs a loan to buy a cutting machine for his tractor. With the help of this loan he can facilitate his work. He hopes to keep on making his own living in order not to ask for help from others. Fadil wants to thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy a cutting machine for the tractor.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1945. She has two children who are adults and have their own families. She is a widow. Dung is retired and now raises chickens to earn a living. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy baby chicks to raise.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks to raise.

loans.name: Dich

texts.en:
Dich was born in 1953. She has five children who have their own families. She is a widow. 

Dich is a farmer to earn a living. She has done this job for 35 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for her fish, baby chicks, and piglets. When she has profits, she wants to enlarge her business by buying more fish and pig to raise.

loans.use: to buy food for her fish, baby chicks, and piglets.

loans.name: Entusa

texts.es:
Entusa, de 61 años de edad ,es una mujer sencilla y bondadosa. Vive en compañía de Julio, su esposo ,ambos tienen 9 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con Antonia, la menor de ellas en la casa que heredó de sus padres.   
Ella es una mujer mayor, junto a su esposo trabajan las tierras que lograron adquirir gracias a su esfuerzo. Sus principales sembríos constan de maíz, habas, cebada y alverja. Los que fertilizan, riegan y extraen , desde las primeras horas del día, hasta el último rayo del sol. En cada cosecha y con el apoyo de sus hijos, trasladan los alimentos a la ciudad mas cercana, donde la comercializan en el mercado principal. Asimismo posee cerdos y ovejas, que alimenta para su propio consumo, más las 2 vacas que posee, producen la leche que consume, de esa manera sostiene su alimentación. Su mayor deseo es seguir sembrando,  por ello juntará más capital de trabajo para asi seguir sembrando aun en más cantidad. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio ,por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Entusa, invertirá los S/. 500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues dentro de algunos meses cosechará maíz.
texts.en:
Entusa, 61, is a simple and generous woman. She lives in a house she inherited from her parents, together with Julio, her husband, and Antonia, the youngest of her nine children.
